Displaying 1 to 57 of 57

## [Cabinet](/Council/Councillors-and-Committees/Cabinet/index.aspx "Cabinet")

 Members of the cabinet, how to ask them a question and responses to questions that have already been asked.

## [Car parking](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-and-Permits.aspx "Car parking")

 Apply for a permit, find a council car park, problem parking, pay or appeal a parking fine, apply for a Blue Badge and more.

## [Care homes](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Residential-care/Find-a-care-home.aspx "Care homes")

 Search the Care Quality Commission directory for a care home in the borough.

## [Career Insights](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-health-and-care-services/Career-Insights.aspx "Career Insights")

 There is a huge range of opportunities available in adult health and social care. Whether you're new to the role, coming back to work in health and social care, or want a career change, there will be a role to suit you. You can find more information of Adult Social Care roles on our Care to join us webpage.

## [Careers and Roles in Adult Social Care and Health](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-health-and-care-services/index.aspx "Careers and Roles in Adult Social Care and Health")

 Adult health and care services careers

## [Carers](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Support-for-carers/Index.aspx "Carers")

 How to get help if you care for a relative or friend with a disability or illness.

## [Celebration ceremony](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Other-ceremonies/Celebration-ceremony.aspx "Celebration ceremony")

 Married abroad? Why not have another ceremony here to celebrate again with family and friends who were unable to attend.

## [Cemeteries](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Cemeteries.aspx "Cemeteries")

 Locations and plans of cemeteries in the Wigan Borough, buy a memorial or report an issue in a cemetery.

## [Ceremonies](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Other-ceremonies/Index.aspx "Ceremonies")

 Renew your wedding vows, book onto a citizenship ceremony, have a baby naming / family welcoming or celebration ceremony.

## [Ceremony FAQs](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/FAQs.aspx "Ceremony FAQs")

 Frequently asked questions about weddings and other ceremonies.

## [Ceremony fees](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Fees/Index.aspx "Ceremony fees")

 Fees for a wedding ceremony, wedding venues and venues for other ceremonies.

## [Check my property address](https://apps.wigan.gov.uk/LandlordsPropertySearch/ "Check my property address")

 Find out if your address has been registered from either your postcode or your street.

## [Child employment and entertainment](/Resident/Education/Employment-and-entertainment/index.aspx "Child employment and entertainment")

 Get licences for children aged 13 and over to undertake work, take part in performances or modelling and how to become a chaperone.

## [Child protection](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Child-protection/Child-protection.aspx "Child protection")

 What to do if you're worried that a child is being harmed and find out how we safeguard children.

## [Childcare](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childcare/Childcare.aspx "Childcare")

 Types of childcare, finding the right one for you and your children and help paying for it.

## [Children in care](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Children-in-care/Children-in-care.aspx "Children in care")

 Help for those leaving care, the council's responsibilities and children's rights.

## [Children with disabilities](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-with-disabilities/Children-with-disabilities.aspx "Children with disabilities")

 Free services, support schemes and short breaks for children with disabilities and their families.

## [Children's centres](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childrens-Centres/Start-Well-Centres.aspx "Children's centres")

 Start Well Family Centres provide activities and services for children under five and their families.

## [Children's Education Advisory Service (CEAS)](https://www.gov.uk/government/groups/the-childrens-education-advisory-service-ceas "Children's Education Advisory Service (CEAS)")

 The Children's Education Advisory Service (CEAS) is an information, advice and support service for families in the armed forces.

## [Children's health and social care](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childrens-health-and-social-care.aspx "Children's health and social care")

 Report abuse, find a children's centre, fostering, children in care, children with disabilities and health and wellbeing.

## [Children's play areas](/Resident/Leisure/Parks/Childrens-play-area.aspx "Children's play areas")

 There are over 100 parks in the borough with play equipment and areas to play in.

## [Children's Social Work Development Hub](/Business/Professionals/Social-Work-Academy/Index.aspx "Children's Social Work Development Hub")

 Everything you need to know about working as a social worker at Wigan Council

## [Chimney smoke in smoke control areas](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Smoke/Smoke-control-areas.aspx "Chimney smoke in smoke control areas")

 Determine whether or not your house is in a smoke control area.

## [Citizenship ceremonies](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Other-ceremonies/Citizenship-ceremonies.aspx "Citizenship ceremonies")

 How to apply for British citizenship and how to book a ceremony.

## [Civil Partnerships](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Civil-partnerships.aspx "Civil Partnerships")

 To register a civil partnership at Wigan Life Centre or Leigh Town Hall, you must make an appointment to give notice.

## [Closed Circuit Television (CCTV)](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Closed-Circuit-Television.aspx "Closed Circuit Television (CCTV)")

 Request access to CCTV footage.

## [Code of Conduct and Policies](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-Learning/Code-of-Conduct-and-Policies.aspx "Code of Conduct and Policies")

 Ensuring everyone has an equal opportunity to learn well in a safe environment

## [Commemorating Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II](/HRHHomepage.aspx "Commemorating Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II")

 Commemorating Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II

## [Common Affordable Scheme Questions](/Resident/Housing/Buying/Common-Affordable-Scheme-Questions.aspx "Common Affordable Scheme Questions")

 Common Affordable Scheme Questions

## [Communities](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/index.aspx "Communities")

 Residents and communities working together to improve the lives of people from all areas of the borough.

## [Community \- Autism Friendly](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Autism-friendly/Community-Autism-Friendly.aspx "Community - Autism Friendly")

 Community inclusion has many benefits \- increased social connections, opportunities to share ideas and talents, and promote equality and diversity. Here's some links to help find out about what's on near you.

## [Community engagement](/Council/Consultations/Current/Community-engagement.aspx "Community engagement")

 We want to hear your views on future use of the play area site at Bexhill Drive, Hindley Green.

## [Community Wealth Building](/Council/The-Deal/Community-Wealth-Building.aspx "Community Wealth Building")

 Community Wealth Building will help us tackle economic inequality locally and create a fairer borough with greater opportunities for all.

## [Complaints](/Council/Contact-us/Complaints.aspx "Complaints")

 Make a general complaint, or register your complaint with a specific council department or service.

## [Complaints, compliments and raising concerns](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/raising-concerns/raising-concerns.aspx "Complaints, compliments and raising concerns")

 Report if you are concerned about someone's welfare or want to complain about a service.

## [Constitution](https://democracy.wigan.gov.uk/ieListDocuments.aspx?CId=352&MId=2756&Ver=4&Info=1&a=1 "Constitution")

 Link to the constitution on democracy

## [Consultation on the Wigan Local Plan](/Council/Consultations/Future-plan/Consultation-on-the-Wigan-Local-Plan.aspx "Consultation on the Wigan Local Plan")

 Consultation on the Wigan Local Plan

## [Consultations and engagement](/Council/Consultations/index.aspx "Consultations and engagement")

 An overview of consultations the council are currently involved with.

## [Consumer advice](/Resident/Consumer-Advice/Consumer-advice.aspx "Consumer advice")

 Consumer advice includes Good Trader Scheme information, Citizens Advice, and how to manage your money.

## [Contaminated land](/Business/Environmental-Health/Pollution/Contaminated-land.aspx "Contaminated land")

 How to report contaminated land to us.

## [Copy Certificates](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Copy-of-certificates.aspx "Copy Certificates")

 Apply for copies of birth, marriage and death certificates in Wigan and Leigh Borough, between 1837 and now.

## [Coronavirus (COVID\-19\) \- updates and support](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Coronavirus/index.aspx "Coronavirus (COVID-19) - updates and support")

 All the latest updates and advice for Coronavirus (COVID\-19\) and how the council can support you.

## [Council bills and queries](/Pay-for-it/Council-invoices/index.aspx "Council bills and queries")

 Make a payment, query an invoice, set up a direct debit and more.

## [Council constitution](https://democracy.wigan.gov.uk/ieListDocuments.aspx?CId=352&MId=2756&Ver=4&Info=1&a=1 "Council constitution")

 How the council operates, how decisions are made and the procedures that are followed.

## [Council homes](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/index.aspx "Council homes")

 Tenancy information and advice on finding a home, applying for the housing register, reporting repairs and more.

## [Council Tax Premiums for unoccupied properties](/Resident/Council-Tax/Council-Tax-Premiums-for-unoccupied-properties.aspx "Council Tax Premiums for unoccupied properties")

 An additional amount of Council Tax is charged when a property is empty for two years or more.

## [Council Tax Reduction \- Disputes and appeals](/Resident/Council-Tax/Discounts-reductions-and-exemptions/Appeals.aspx "Council Tax Reduction - Disputes and appeals")

 What to do if you do not agree with a decision we have made about your Council Tax Reduction calculation.

## [Councillors and Committees](/Council/Councillors-and-Committees/index.aspx "Councillors and Committees")

 Find your local Councillor, council meetings, decisions, plans and more.

## [Counter terrorism](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Counter-terrorism/Index.aspx "Counter terrorism")

 What to do in a terrorist attack, identifying suspicious behaviour / package and how to help prevent terrorism

## [Country parks and nature reserves](/Resident/Leisure/Parks/Country-parks-and-nature-reserves.aspx "Country parks and nature reserves")

 There is so much to see and discover in our countryside, woodlands and nature reserves.

## [COVID\-19 online results checker](https://apps.wigan.gov.uk/covid19/CheckTestResult "COVID-19 online results checker")

 COVID\-19 online results checker

 Information on the variations of tests available for Covid\-19

## [Cremations and burials](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Funerals/Burial-and-cremations/index.aspx "Cremations and burials")

 Arranging a cremation, buying a grave, burial rights, buying a memorial and more.

## [Crime and emergencies](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Crime-and-emergencies.aspx "Crime and emergencies")

 Report crime, advice on crime prevention, what to do in a case of emergencies and who to contact.

## [Cyber terrorism](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Counter-terrorism/Cyber-terrorism.aspx "Cyber terrorism")

 What cyber terrorism is and how to defend yourself against it

## [Cycle Three Sisters](/BeWell/Activities-sports/Cycle-Three-Sisters.aspx "Cycle Three Sisters")

 A free cycling event returns to the Three Sisters Race Circuit in Ashton\-in\-Makerfield

## [Cycling](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Travel/Cycling.aspx "Cycling")

 We are making improvements so that cycling is safer, more secure and enjoyable in Wigan Borough.

# Jobs, careers and skills

![Adult learning courses](/Images/Resident/Jobs-and-careers/Free-adult-learning-opportunities-banner.png)## Banner

Take a look at our wide range of free adult learning courses

Find education, skills and work support for young people

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Benefits and grants](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Benefit-Grants.aspx "Go to Benefits and grants from here")/Free school meals, pupil premium, and EYPP

# Free school meals, pupil premium, and EYPP

* Free school meals \- Save your household up to £418 a year per child
* Pupil premium – Get £1300 for your child’s school to improve education
* Early years pupil premium (EYPP) – over £300 for your child’s early years and childcare provider to improve provision

## Can my child get free school meals, pupil premium or EYPP?

**You should claim your Free School meals from the local authority where you live and not from the local authority that the school is based.**

### Nursery \- pre\-school

If your child is aged 2, 3 or 4 years old and is attending a maintained nursery class or nursery school all day and you or your partner are in receipt of one of the qualifying benefits your child could be eligible for free school meals.

Early Years Pupil Premium (EYPP) is additional funding for early years settings to improve the education they provide for 3 and 4 year olds whose parents are in receipt of qualifying benefits or for children who are looked after or have previously been looked after children.

### Infants \- Reception, Years 1 and 2

All children get free school meals if they are in Reception, Year 1 and Year 2\.

If you or your partner receive one of the qualifying benefits you can apply for pupil premium to get extra money for your child’s school.

### Older Children \- Year 3 to Year 11

Your child is eligible for free school meals if you or your partner receive one of the qualifying benefits.

When making your application you are also applying for the pupil premium for your child’s school.

### Students in Further Education

If your child is aged between 16 and 18 and is attending a further education funded institution you will be entitled to claim free meals if you or your partner receive one of the qualifying benefits.

Students who turn 19 during their studies will remain eligible for a free meal until the end of the academic year in which they turn 19 or to the end of their study programme, whichever is sooner.

There is no pupil premium for further education.

## What are the qualifying benefits?

You will be entitled to apply for free school meals and/or pupil premium for your child if you or your partner receive one or more of the following benefits: 

* Universal Credit (see information on new eligibility criteria below)
* Income Support
* Income\-based Jobseeker's Allowance
* Income\-related Employment and Support Allowance
* The guaranteed part of State Pension Credit
* Support under part 6 of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999
* Child Tax Credit (providing you are not entitled to Working Tax Credit and have an annual gross income of no more than £16,190, as assessed by the Inland Revenue)
* Working Tax Credit run\-on (paid 4 weeks after you stop qualifying for Working Tax Credit)

## Apply for free school meals, pupil premium and EYPP

* [Apply for free school meals, pupil premium and EYPP](https://finforms.wigan.gov.uk/Viewer-VicForms.asp?user=anon&Form=Wigan%20Education%20and%20Childcare%20Benefits%20Application%20(1.0).wdf "Apply for free school meals and pupil premium")

When you apply you will get an instant decision on your claim. We will contact the school to confirm your child’s eligibility.

If your child is in Reception, Year 1 or Year 2 and you or your partner are in receipt of qualifying benefits you should still complete the application for pupil premium online because your child’s school will receive an extra £1300 per year.

## New eligibility criteria \- Universal Credit

From 1st April 2018, the Department for Education made amendments to the eligibility criteria for free school meals to reflect the roll out of Universal Credit full service.

From this date onwards your child will only be eligible for free schools meals under Universal Credit if you and your partner have net earned income of less than £7,400 per year (assessed from up to three of your most recent assessment periods).

The Universal Credit rollout is currently expected to be completed by March 2025\.

However in the meantime, transitional protections will be implemented for those children who might otherwise lose free school meals following the update to the eligibility criteria.

The transitional protections will be awarded as follows:

* Any child who **is in receipt of free school meals BEFORE 1 April 2018**, will continue to receive free school meals whilst Universal Credit is rolled out (until March 2025\) regardless of any changes in you or your partners income
* Any child **who gains eligibility for free school meals AFTER 1 April 2018** will continue to receive free school meals whilst Universal Credit is rolled out (until March 2025\) regardless of any changes in you or your partners income

Once Universal Credit is fully rolled out any existing children who no longer meet the eligibility criteria at that point will continue to receive free school meals until the end of their current phase of education, ie primary or secondary.

## What is the pupil premium?

The pupil premium is extra funding for your child’s education. It is provided by the government and is normally claimed as part of free school meals if you or your partner are in receipt of one of the qualifying benefits.

Your child’s school will receive £1300 per pupil for six years to support your child’s education including help with the cost of school trips, teaching assistant staff and after school programs (see individual schools websites).

## What happens if my circumstances change?

You must tell us straight away if you move out of Wigan Borough even if your child remains at the same school.

## Top tasks

### Apply for It

1. [Apply for free school meals, pupil premium and EYPP](https://finforms.wigan.gov.uk/Viewer-VicForms.asp?user=anon&Form=Wigan%20Education%20and%20Childcare%20Benefits%20Application%20(1.0).wdf "Go to the Apply for free school meals, pupil premium and EYPP page")
### Report it

1. [Change of circumstances](https://finforms.wigan.gov.uk/Viewer-VicForms.asp?user=anon&Form=Wigan%20Change%20of%20Circumstances%20(1.4).wdf "Go to the Change of circumstances page")

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Environmental problems](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Environmental-Problems.aspx "Go to Environmental problems from here")/Pests

# Pests

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

If you live in a domestic property, are a council tenant or live in privately rented accommodation, we can provide advice and treatment if you have a problem with insects or vermin. We will visit you and carry out a full assessment, followed by treatment to eradicate your pest problem.

If you are a business and require pest control for commercial properties and schools, please see our [Pest control for businesses](/Business/Environmental-Health/Pest-control.aspx "Pest control for businesses") page.

## Book a pest control treatment

We carry out treatments by appointment only. 

* [Book a pest control appointment](https://wigan.zipporah.co.uk/Pests/PestControl "Make a pest control appointment")

The Pest Control Officer can arrive at any time between 8am and 4pm, Monday to Friday. Please ensure an adult is present at the property and that the relevant preparatory work has taken place.

Fees are payable at the time of booking. Council tenants will need to provide a rent reference number when booking the appointment. 

You will receive an email confirmation of your booking upon successful submission.

## What pests do we treat?

Please see the [pest control guidance](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pest-Control-Guidance.pdf "Pest Control Guidance") which includes the details of the pests we deal with:

* Ants
* Australian Spider Beetle
* Biscuit Beetle also known as the Bread Beetle
* Bed Bugs
* Carpet Beetle and larvae (woolly bears)
* Cockroaches
* Fleas
* Flying insects
* Mice
* Rats
* Wasps

We do not provide treatments for bees. If we visit your property and identify that the pests are bees there will be no refunds.

* [Pest control guidance \- Bees](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pest-Control-Bees.pdf "Pest Control - Bees")
* [Bee identification and swarm information (external link)](https://www.bbka.org.uk/swarm)

There are other pests that we do not treat but provide guidance for.

* [See pest control guidance for pests we do not treat](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pest-Control-no-treatment.pdf "Pest Control - no treatment")

## Fees

Our fees include all materials needed to carry out the treatment required \- there are no additional costs. We also offer you free advice as part of your treatment to prevent further pest infestations.

**No refunds will be given for cancelled appointments once treatment has already started.**

Domestic charges 2024/25
| Pest | Number of visits | Prices (including VAT) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Rats | 3 | £150\.00 |
| Mice \- inside only | 3 | £150\.00 |
| Cockroaches | 3 | £160\.00 |
| Wasps | 1 | £70\.00 |
| Ants \- inside only | 1 | £70\.00 |
| Fleas | 1 | £120\.00 |
| Bed Bugs \- requires 2 operatives | 1 | £150\.00 |
| Flying insects | 1 | £100\.00 |
| Unknown pest \- identification only, no treatment | 1 | £55\.00 |

Council tenants have the costs for all pest control treatments covered within their rent charge. The rent reference number will be required.

### Additional visits

If your treatment requires more than one visit to complete the treatment, the operative will book this in for you when visiting your property. If you wish to change the date please complete the [Change/Cancel online form](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Change-Cancel-pest-control-appointment.aspx "Change or cancel your pest control appointment").

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Make a pest control appointment](https://wigan.zipporah.co.uk/Pests/PestControl "Go to the Make a pest control appointment page")
2. [Change or cancel your pest control appointment](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Change-Cancel-pest-control-appointment.aspx "Go to the Change or cancel your pest control appointment page")

## Contact us

* [Email](/Contacts/Pest-control.aspx#ContactEmail)

* [Pest control we do no treat](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pest-Control-no-treatment.pdf "Go to the Pest control we do no treat page")134 Kb
* [Pest Control \- Bees](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pest-Control-Bees.pdf "Go to the Pest Control - Bees page")60 Kb
* [Differences between Wasps and Bees factsheet](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Differences-between-wasps-and-bees-factsheet.pdf "Go to the Differences between Wasps and Bees factsheet page")88 Kb

## [Refugee Awareness Week](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Refugees/Index.aspx "Refugee Awareness Week")

 Celebrating the many contributions that refugees make to society, refugee stories and what you can do.

## [Refuse collections](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Refuse collections")

 Which bin to use, putting your bin out, bin collection dates, missed bins, replacement bins, bulky item collections, finding a recycling centre and more.

## [Register a birth](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Births/Registering-a-birth.aspx "Register a birth")

 Make an appointment to register a birth, what details you need to bring and who needs to attend.

## [Register a death](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Register-a-death.aspx "Register a death")

 How to register a death and the details you will need.

## [Register a food business](http://www.wigan.gov.uk/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/Food-premises-registration.aspx "Register a food business")

 If you wish to store, prepare, distribute or sell food at any premises you must register at least 28 days before opening.

## [Regulation services](/Contacts/Regulation-services.aspx "Regulation services")

 Regulation services

## [Religious ceremonies](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Religious-venues.aspx "Religious ceremonies")

 If you are having a marriage or civil ceremony in a Church of England or Wales, you may be asked to give notice at your local register office.

## [Reminiscing Together Workshops](/Resident/Museums-archives/Reminiscing-Together-Workshops.aspx "Reminiscing Together Workshops")

 Reminiscing Together Workshops

## [Renewal of vows](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Other-ceremonies/Renewal-of-vows.aspx "Renewal of vows")

 Offering couples the perfect opportunity to recreate the magic of their wedding day.

## [Rent a garage](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Rent-a-garage.aspx "Rent a garage")

 Anyone can rent a garage, and you don't have to be a Wigan Council tenant.

## [Repairs and improvements](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Repairs/index.aspx "Repairs and improvements")

 Council house repairs, bathroom refurbishments, property improvements, gas services, asbestos and smoke detectors.

## [Report a change](/Resident/Council-Tax/Report-a-change/Index.aspx "Report a change")

 Tell us if you're circumstances have changed or if your account details are incorrect.

## [Report a change in circumstances](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Report-a-change.aspx "Report a change in circumstances")

 Tell us about a change in your circumstances that may affect the amount of housing benefit you receive.

## [Report a missed bin](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Missed-bins.aspx "Report a missed bin")

 If your bin has not been collected on your scheduled day you can report it as missed.

## [Report abuse and neglect](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Report-it/index.aspx "Report abuse and neglect")

 Report if you have concerns over the welfare of adults and children.

## [Report an abandoned vehicle](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Report-an-abandoned-vehicle.aspx "Report an abandoned vehicle")

 Find out what abandoned vehicles we can and cannot investigate and how to report it.

## [Report bins and litter](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Rubbish-and-Litter/Rubbish-and-Litter.aspx "Report bins and litter")

 Report fly\-tipping, problems with rubbish and litter, broken glass, spillages on the road.

## [Report concern of an adult or child](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Report-it/index.aspx "Report concern of an adult or child")

 Report if you have concerns over the welfare of adults and children.

## [Report it](/Report-it/Report-a-problem.aspx "Report it")

 Report a problem using one of our online forms.

## [Request a repair](https://housingonline.wigan.gov.uk "Request a repair")

 Report repairs needed in your home if you live in a council\-owned house.

## [Request a replacement bin/caddy](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Request-a-replacement-bin.aspx "Request a replacement bin/caddy")

 Replace damaged bins, request larger/smaller bins or remove one you no longer want.

## [Residential homes](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Residential-care/Find-a-care-home.aspx "Residential homes")

 Search the Care Quality Commission directory for a care home in the borough.

## [Resources for community groups](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Resources/Resources.aspx "Resources for community groups")

 A range of resources to help set up and run voluntary and community organisations of all sizes.

## [Resources for school settings](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Health-and-wellbeing/Resources-for-school-settings.aspx "Resources for school settings")

 Resources to support health and wellbeing.

## [Restoring Haigh Hall \- The Masterplan](/Council/Projects/Haigh-Hall/Index.aspx "Restoring Haigh Hall - The Masterplan")

 All about our ambitious plan to repair and restore Haigh Hall to its former glory and how you can share your feedback on the plans.

## [Ring and ride](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Travel-and-access.aspx "Ring and ride")

 Bus/travel passes, services and access to facilities to help older people and those with disabilities to get out and about.

## [Road safety cycle training](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Road-safety-cycle-training.aspx "Road safety cycle training")

 National cycle training for children and adults.

## [Road schemes](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Road-schemes.aspx "Road schemes")

 Upcoming road schemes including bus priority programme and safer cycle routes.

## [Running your business](/Business/Business-Support/Running-your-business/Index.aspx "Running your business")

 What you need to know for day\-to\-day business operations.

# Coronavirus (COVID\-19\) \- updates and support

![Coronavirus-Banner](/Images/Resident/Crime/Coronavirus-Banner.jpg)

* [Coronavirus updates and advice](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Coronavirus/Coronavirus-update-and-advice.aspx "Health protection services")
* [Health protection services](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/fit-and-well/health-protection.aspx "Health protection services")
* 
* 

## Useful information on Coronavirus

If you use Sign Language as your first language and have been affected by Covid\-19, there's support available to you. There is information and advice in the video above, and for further support contact Topps on 07410 380366 or email [bookings@topplanguagesolutions.co.uk](mailto:bookings@topplanguagesolutions.co.uk)

## News on health services and COVID\-19

There are no results that match your criteria.

## Be Kind

It’s so important to be helpful, generous and thoughtful towards others and yourself. So [join our movement to spread kindness](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Be-Kind/Index.aspx "Be Kind").

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/Apply for it

# Apply for it

Use the sections below to find out how to apply for various council services:

## Bins and recycling

* [Recycling centre permit](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres") \- only needed if you use a trailer or van to transport your items
* [Bulky waste collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bulky-collections.aspx "Bulky waste collections") \- book or cancel a collection date
* [Assisted bin collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Assisted-bin-collections.aspx "Assisted bin collections") \- for help putting your bin out
* [New or replacement bin/food caddy](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Request-a-replacement-bin.aspx "Request new or replacement bin") \- for additional or replacement for damaged bins

## Planning and building control

* [Planning permission](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Apply.aspx "Apply for planning permission")
* [Building control](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Building-control/Apply-for-building-regulations.aspx "Apply for building regulations approval") \- building regulation approval (building notices, full plans submissions etc)

## Council Tax

* [Manage your Council Tax account](/MyAccount/My-Account.aspx "MyAccount") \- login or register for MyAccount
* [Change in circumstances](/Resident/Council-Tax/Report-a-change/Index.aspx "Report a change") \- address changes, someone has died, someone has left or joined the household, moving into or out of the borough and more
* [Appeals](/Resident/Council-Tax/Appeals.aspx "Appeals - Council Tax") \- against decisions or valuation bands

## Benefits and grants

* [Housing Benefit/Council Tax reduction](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/apply-for-benefit.aspx "Apply for Housing Benefit and/or Council Tax Reduction") \- new claims
* [Free school meals and pupil premium](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Free-school-meals.aspx "Free school meals, pupil premium and early years pupil premium (EYPP)") \- new claims
* [Change in circumstances](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/apply-for-benefit.aspx "Apply for Housing Benefit and/or Council Tax Reduction") \- tell us about a change
* [Discretionary Housing Payments](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Housing-Benefits/Discretionary-housing-payments.aspx "Discretionary Housing Payments") \- emergency short term help paying your rent
* [Housing Benefit \- query an overpayment](/Contacts/Benefits-invoice-query.aspx "Housing Benefit overpayments")
* [Appeals](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Appeals.aspx "Appeals - Housing Benefit or Council Tax Reduction") \- against a decision we have made about your Housing Benefit
* [Universal Credit](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Universal-Credit.aspx "Universal Credit")
* [Local welfare support](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Local-Welfare-Support.aspx "Welfare support") \- help for people in crisis including food parcels and homelessness

## Parking, roads and travel

* [Parking permit](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-permits/Permits.aspx "Parking permit") \- apply for or renew a resident parking permit
* [Blue badge permit](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Blue-Badge-permit/Blue-Badge-permit-application.aspx "Blue Badges") \- for those with disabilities to legally park close to places they need to visit
* [Disabled bay marking](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Disabled-parking-bay-application.aspx "Disabled parking bays") \- advisory marking outside your home
* [Grit bins](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Grit-bin.aspx "Grit bins") \- move, refill or get a new grit bin
* [Driveway access](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Driveway-access.aspx "Driveway access") \- dropped kerbs and preventing driveway obstructions
* [Temporarily close a road](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Temporary-road-closure-application.aspx "Temporary road closure application") \- for maintenance, street parties etc.
* [Events on the highway](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Events-on-the-highway.aspx "Events on the highway") \- for parades, walking days etc.

## Libraries, museums and archives

* [Library card](/Resident/Libraries/Services.aspx "Library services")
* [Renew books](/Resident/Libraries/Renew-library-books.aspx "Renew library books")
* [Hire a room](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/Venue-hire.aspx "Venue hire") \- the Museum has a meeting room suitable for 30 people
* [Volunteering (culture and leisure)](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Culture-and-Leisure/index.aspx "Culture and Leisure") \- opportunities to help the community

## Leisure

* [Be Well Card (previously known as a Lifestyle card)](https://bewellwigan.org/membership/ "Get a Be Well card") \- membership to leisure centres
* [Swimming lessons](https://bewellwigan.org/activities/swimming/ "Sport, keeping fit and healthy living")

## Education and families

* [Primary school place](/Resident/Education/Schools/School-Admissions/Primary-schools.aspx "Primary school admissions")
* [Secondary school place](/Resident/Education/Schools/School-Admissions/Secondary-schools.aspx "Secondary schools")
* [Moving schools](/Resident/Education/Schools/School-Admissions/Moving-Schools.aspx "Moving schools") \- transferring schools during the school year
* [Appeals](/Resident/Education/Schools/School-Admissions/Appeals.aspx "School admissions appeals") \- if your child is refused a place at your preferred school
* [Become a school governor](/Resident/Education/Schools/School-Governors/Governor-vacancies.aspx "Governor vacancies")
* [Bus passes](/Resident/Education/Home-to-school-travel/Home-to-school-travel.aspx "Home to School Travel") \- travelling from home to school
* [Free school meals](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Free-school-meals.aspx "Free school meals, pupil premium and early years pupil premium (EYPP)")
* [Music lessons](/Resident/Education/Wigan-Music-Service/Instrumental-and-vocal-lessons.aspx "Instrumental and vocal lessons")
* [Hire a musical instrument](/Resident/Education/Wigan-Music-Service/Musical-instrument-hire.aspx "Musical instrument hire")
* [Join a choir](/Resident/Education/Wigan-Music-Service/Weekly-Ensembles.aspx "Weekly Ensembles")
* [Help with costs of learning an instrument](/Resident/Education/Wigan-Music-Service/Help-with-the-costs-of-learning-to-play.aspx "Help with the costs of learning to play an instrument")
* [Free childcare for 2 year olds](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childcare/Free-childcare-2-year-olds.aspx "Free early education and childcare for 2 year olds")
* [Free childcare for 3\-4 year olds](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childcare/Free-childcare-3-and-4-year-olds.aspx "Free early education and childcare for 3 and 4 year olds")
* [Register for Sure Start children's centres](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childrens-Centres/Start-Well-Centres.aspx "Start Well Family Centres (Sure Start Children's Centres)")
* [Child employment licence](/Resident/Education/Employment-and-entertainment/Child-employment.aspx "Child employment")
* [Child entertainment licence](/Resident/Education/Employment-and-entertainment/Child-entertainment.aspx "Child entertainment")
* [Chaperone licence](/Resident/Education/Employment-and-entertainment/Chaperone-licence.aspx "Chaperone approval licences")

## Environmental

* [Bulky waste collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bulky-collections.aspx "Bulky waste collections") \-  book or cancel a collection date
* [Pest control](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pests.aspx "Pests") \- make or change an appointment

## Births, deaths and marriages

* [Order a copy certificate](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Copy-of-certificates.aspx "Copies of certificates")

### Births

* [Register a birth](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Births/Registering-a-birth.aspx "Register a birth")
* [Re\-register a birth](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Births/Re-registering-a-birth.aspx "Re-register a birth")
* [Correct a birth registration](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Births/Birth-certificate-corrections.aspx "Birth certificate corrections")

### Deaths

* [Register a death](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Register-a-death.aspx "Register a death")
* [Buy a grave or memorial](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Funerals/Buy-a-memorial/index.aspx "Buy a memorial")
* [Tell us once service](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Tell-Us-Once.aspx "Tell Us Once") \- when someone has died inform many services and organisations in one go
* [Correct a death registration](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Death-certificate-corrections.aspx "Death certificate corrections")
* [Search burial records](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Record-searches.aspx "Search burial records")
* [Fixed price funeral service](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Funerals/Residents-funeral-services.aspx "Wigan and Leigh Residents Funeral Services")

### Marriages

* [Give notice of marriage](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Giving-notice-of-marriage.aspx "Giving notice of marriage (including same-sex marriages)")
* [Give notice of civil partnership](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Civil-partnerships.aspx "Giving notice of civil partnerships")
* [Book a wedding ceremony](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-Civil-Partnerships/Booking-and-paying-for-your-ceremony.aspx "Booking and paying for your wedding ceremony")

## Health and social care

* [Volunteering](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Health/Volunteering-in-Adult-Social-Care.aspx "Volunteering in adult social care") \- in adult social care

### Children

* [Register for Sure Start children's centres](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childrens-Centres/Start-Well-Centres.aspx "Start Well Family Centres (Sure Start Children's Centres)")
* [Foster carers](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Fostering/Application-process.aspx "Application process")
* [Free childcare for 2 year olds](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childcare/Free-childcare-2-year-olds.aspx "Free early education and childcare for 2 year olds")
* [Free childcare for 3\-4 year olds](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childcare/Free-childcare-3-and-4-year-olds.aspx "Free early education and childcare for 3 and 4 year olds")

### Adults

* [Social care assessment](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Getting-help/social-care-assessment.aspx "Social care assessment") \- ask us to assess your care and support needs
* [Equipment and adaptations](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Your-independence/equipment-and-adaptations.aspx "Social care assessment") \- help with aids after injury or illness
* [Extra care housing](/Resident/Housing/Homes-for-older-people/Extra-Care-Housing.aspx "Extra care housing") \- for older people to live on their own with 24 hour additional care and support
* [Sheltered accommodation](/Resident/Housing/Homes-for-older-people/Council-owned-homes.aspx "Sheltered accommodation") \- for older people to live on their own with added security and support
* [Supported living accommodation](/Resident/Housing/Supported-living/supported-living-and-accommodation.aspx "Types of accommodation") \- for older people to live independently in accommodation with support
* [Becomes a shared lives champion](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Shared-lives/Index.aspx "Shared Lives") \- volunteering with adults who need support due to disability, age or illness

### Disabilities

* [Special Educational Needs and Disabilities \- advice and support](/Resident/Education/Special-Educational-Needs-and-Disability/Local-Offer/Parent/Advice/Support-and-advice/IAS-Service.aspx "SEND Information, Advice and Support (IAS) Service")

## Housing

* [Join the housing register](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Housing-register/Apply.aspx "Apply to join the housing register")
* [Extra care housing](/Resident/Housing/Homes-for-older-people/Extra-Care-Housing.aspx "Extra care housing") \- for older people to live on their own with 24 hour additional care and support
* [Sheltered accommodation](/Resident/Housing/Homes-for-older-people/Council-owned-homes.aspx "Sheltered accommodation") \- for older people to live on their own with added security and support
* [Supported living accommodation](/Resident/Housing/Supported-living/supported-living-and-accommodation.aspx "Types of accommodation") \- for older people to live independently in accommodation with support
* [Affordable homes to buy](/Resident/Housing/Buying/Properties-available-to-buy.aspx "Properties available to buy") \- properties for sale, some available through schemes such as equity loan, shared ownership or help to buy
* [Rent a garage](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Rent-a-garage.aspx "Rent a garage") \- anyone can rent a garage you don't have to be a council home tenant

### Council tenants

* [Housing repairs](/Contacts/Council-homes/Request-repair.aspx "Housing repairs and improvements") \- request a repair on your council home
* [Mutual exchange](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/What-are-my-housing-options/Mutual-exchange.aspx "Mutual exchange - swapping your home") \- apply to swap your council home
* [Housing support](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Your-tenancy/Support-services/Housing-support.aspx "Housing support") \- services for families with difficulties in their accommodation
* [Home contents insurance](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Your-tenancy/Home-contents-insurance.aspx "Home content insurance")
* [Assisted gardening scheme](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Your-tenancy/Support-services/Assisted-gardening-scheme.aspx "Assisted gardening scheme") \- if you are physically unable to maintain your garden
* [Amending or ending your tenancy](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Your-tenancy/Amending-ending-your-tenancy.aspx "Amending your tenancy").

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/MyAccount

# MyAccount

MyAccount is a resident portal allowing you to view your council tax and housing benefit accounts, and report and track progress of issues you’ve raised with us.

[Registering for an account](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/ "Login or register for MyAccount") is easy and takes just a couple of minutes.

* Visit our [MyAccount help page](/MyAccount/MyAccount-Support.aspx "MyAccount help") for support on setting up your MyAccount
* [Not online? Take a look at our quick digital guides to help you get online](/Council/Digital-Wigan/Help-and-support.aspx "Digital help and support")

You will need to [register for Housing Online](https://housingonline.wigan.gov.uk "Search for a home") to view your Housing Rents account.

## What services can I access?

MyAccount allows you to securely access the following range of council services:

* [**Council Tax**](/MyAccount/CouncilTax/Council-Tax-FAQs.aspx "MyAccount - Council Tax help") \- View your Council Tax statements. Visit our [Council Tax section](/Resident/Council-Tax/Council-Tax.aspx "Council Tax") to set up a direct debit, make payments, apply for discounts, report a change and amend address details
* [**Housing Benefit**](/MyAccount/Housing-Benefits-Support.aspx "MyAccount - Housing Benefits help") \- View your account details. Visit our [benefits and grants section](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Benefit-Grants.aspx "Benefits and grants") to apply for Housing Benefit, Council Tax Reduction or free school meals and report a change
* [**Report issues**](/MyAccount/Report-it-help.aspx "Report it - Help") \- Report a wide range of issues within the borough ([see a full list of what issues you can report](/MyAccount/Report-it-help.aspx "Report it - Help")).

For further information or if you experience any problems setting up your MyAccount, see our [MyAccount frequently asked questions](/MyAccount/MyAccount-Support.aspx "MyAccount help").

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Login or register for MyAccount](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/ "Go to the Login or register for MyAccount page")

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Council Tax](/Resident/Council-Tax/Council-Tax.aspx "Go to Council Tax from here")/How much is my Council Tax?

# Council Tax valuation bands

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

* [Council Tax charges 2024\-25](/Resident/Council-Tax/How-much-is-my-Council-tax/Charges-2024-2025.aspx "Council Tax charges 2024-2025")
* [Council Tax Additional Information Sheet 2024\-2025](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Council-Tax/CTAX-Additional-Information-Sheet.pdf "Council Tax Additional Information Sheet").

Most domestic property, owned or rented, has a Council Tax band. Your home has been allocated one of eight bands according to its market value at 1st April 1991\.

The price of your home in 2024 is not a good guide as to what your band should be.

Your bill states which band applies to your home.

Council tax valuations
| Band | Property values at 1st April 1991 | \*Estimated number of properties for 2024/2025 | % of total properties |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| A | Under £40,000 | 68,803 | 45\.09% |
| B | £40,001 to £52,000 | 34,516 | 22\.62% |
| C | £52,001 to £68,000 | 25,587 | 16\.77% |
| D | £68,001 to £88,000 | 13,365 | 8\.76% |
| E | £88,001 to £120,000 | 7,596 | 4\.98% |
| F | £120,001 to £160,000 | 2,011 | 1\.32% |
| G | £160,001 to £320,000 | 648 | 0\.42% |
| H | Over £320,000 | 53 | 0\.03% |
| Total | | 152,579 |  |

\*Estimated number of properties in the Wigan Borough Council area.

The Valuation Office Agency is responsible for setting the bands for Council Tax properties and the rateable values for non\-domestic properties.

If you wish to appeal against your banding or rateable value you should contact the [valuation office (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/council-tax "Disagree with your Council Tax band") and not the council. You must continue to pay your existing bill while you are waiting for the results of an appeal.

Customers seeking to have their property deleted from the Council Tax list that are:

* Derelict
* Undergoing major renovations
* Demolished.

Can access a [Council Tax proposal form (external link)](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/65bd064263a23d000dc82132/Council_Tax_proposal_form.pdf) on GOV.UK, this form needs to be completed for properties in England.

Further helpful information from the Valuation Office Agency can be found below:

* [How domestic properties are assessed for Council Tax bands (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/understand-how-council-tax-bands-are-assessed)
* [Council Tax band changes (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/council-tax-band-changes)

There are also some helpful videos on the [Valuation Office Agencies Youtube Channel (external link)](https://www.youtube.com/@VOAgovuk).

Find more information about the [Greater Manchester Mayoral Police and Crime Commissioner Precept and the Mayoral General Precept (including Fire Services) (external link)](https://www.greatermanchester-ca.gov.uk/who-we-are/accounts-transparency-and-governance/council-tax/).

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Consumer advice](/Resident/Consumer-Advice/Consumer-advice.aspx "Go to Consumer advice from here")/Good Trader Scheme

# Good Trader Scheme

## How do I find a trader?

* [Search for a trader](http://goodtraderscheme.com/ "Search for a Trader")

## How do traders join the scheme?

Traders apply to the scheme and are verified if they commit to following consumer protection and other relevant legislation.

## How does it work?

Consumers award rate scheme members on a star rating of one to five. The more satisfied the customer is, the better the rating.

* [Rate a trader](http://goodtraderscheme.com/ "Rate a Trader")

## Do scheme members offer the lowest price?

We always advise customers to get at least three quotes and keep in mind that the cheapest quote is not always the best one.

If you change your mind after the trader has quoted, or if after work has started you ask for additional work to be done, you should ask for a revised price as this may cost more.

## Do trading standards guarantee the quality of the work?

Scheme members agree to comply with the law. However we can not guarantee the quality of their work.

## What if I’m not happy with the work?

Although we don’t guarantee the quality of the work, we will investigate poor ratings and take action where necessary.

If we do this, we will not pass on your details to any trader without your consent.

We ask you to be as fair as possible when evaluating your trader, keeping in mind that all traders experience occasional problems outside their control. If you do have a problem you should contact us.

## 2023 Good Trader Scheme Award Winners

* Good Trader of the Year: Wigan \- Gerrards Carpets and Upholstery Cleaners
* Good Trader of the Year: Leigh \- GJM School of Motoring
* Highly Commended Trader: Wigan \- Bathtek North West
* Highly Commended Trader: Leigh \- Elite365 Locksmiths
* Best Newcomer: Wigan \- Handyman Repairs
* Best Newcomer: Leigh \- Waste Wizards.

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Planning and building control](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/index.aspx "Go to Planning and building control from here")/[Planning](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Index.aspx "Go to Planning from here")/Apply for planning permission

# Apply for planning permission

If you have looked at [do I need planning permission (external link)](https://www.planningportal.co.uk/permission "Do I need planning permission?") but are still confused you can apply for a lawful development certificate.

* [Find out how to apply for a lawful development certificate (LDC) to determine if you need planning permission](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Lawful-Development-Certificate.aspx "Lawful Development Certificate - find out if you need planning permission").

When you are ready to submit a planning application you can do this online through the [Planning Portal (external link)](https://www.planningportal.co.uk/applications "Planning Portal - applications").

## Before you apply

Take advantage of our pre\-application advice service so you can get 'in\-principle' feedback before you submit a planning application. This helps you to avoid delays and submit a successful proposal.

* [Request pre\-application advice](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Pre-application-advice.aspx "Get pre-application advice").

## Using the Planning Portal

Here's what you will need to do:

* Go to the [Planning Portal (external link) website](https://www.planningportal.co.uk/ "Planning portal")
* Type in your name and postcode
* Select a form for the type of application you are making \- for help choosing the right form see [what types of application there are (external link)](https://www.planningportal.co.uk/planning/planning-applications/how-to-apply/planning-permission-and-building-regulations-approval "Planning portal - permission types")
* Login or register on the portal
* Complete the form with details about the work you want to do
* Add supporting documents \- like your site and [location plans](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Getting-a-location-plan.aspx "Getting a location plan")
* Check your application
* Your fee will be calculated and you can then pay online and submit your application.

Please note that where an application is invalid and remains invalid for a period of 14 days or greater, the application will be returned and the council will retain a portion of the application fee to cover the administrative costs incurred.

This will depend on the scale of development proposed, as stated below.

**Administrative fee for 2023/24:**

* Advertisements \- £50
* Householder \- £50
* Minor \- £75
* Small major \- £100
* Large major \- £250

## Getting help with the Planning Portal

Unfortunately the council can't help you use the Planning Portal system. If you have difficulties when using the portal:

* See their [frequently asked questions (external link)](https://www.planningportal.co.uk/services/help/faq "Planning portal faqs")
* Use their [help centre (external link)](https://www.planningportal.co.uk/services/help "Planning Portal help centre").

## Top tasks

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Leisure](/Resident/Leisure/index.aspx "Go to Leisure from here")/Leisure activities for young people

# Leisure activities for young people

## Libraries

We don't just offer the latest books and audio visual material we have play sessions for toddlers, storytime for under 5s and homework clubs for older children and more!

* [Find out what's on at our libraries](/Resident/Libraries/Events.aspx "What's on - Libraries")

## Museums

At the Museum of Wigan Life you can discover the people and places of Wigan Borough both past and present. With changing exhibits and activities for young people there's always something new to see.

* [Find out what's on at the Museum of Wigan Life](/Resident/Museums-archives/whats-on.aspx "What's on - Museums and archives")

[Trencherfield Mill](/Resident/Museums-archives/Trencherfield-Mill-Engine.aspx "Trencherfield Mill Steam Engine") is also worth a visit to see one of the finest working examples of a steam engine in action.

## Sport

* [Local leisure centres](https://bewellwigan.org/location/leisure-centres/ "Leisure centres") \- offering swimming and fitness classes
* [Skateboarding and indoor climbing at Howe Bridge leisure centre](https://bewellwigan.org/activities/play-climb-skate/ "Adventure Play, Climb and Skate")
* [Let’s Get Movin’](https://bewellwigan.org/membership/ "Junior memberships") \- A fun and innovative family programme for 0\-17 year olds as part of Be Well leisure's junior membership provision
* [Swimming lessons](https://bewellwigan.org/activities/swimming/learn-to-swim/ "Kids swimming lessons")
* [Watersports and adventure activities](https://bewellwigan.org/location/attractions/scotmans-flash/ "Scotman's Flash Activity Centre") \- At Scotman's Flash outdoor adventure centre and nature reserve
* [Gymnastics academy](https://bewellwigan.org/activities/gymnastics/ "Gymnastics at Robin Park") \- Pre\-school and recreational sessions, adult lessons and the gymnastics squad
* [Tennis academy](https://bewellwigan.org/activities/tennis/ "Tennis at Robin Park") \- Coaching, competition, team tennis, beginner and advanced classes, social evenings and fitness classes
* [Parks](/Resident/Leisure/Parks/Index.aspx "Parks") \- Our parks offer great spaces to get active, including nature reserves, playing fields and playgrounds
* [Wigan STEAM](https://www.everydaywigan.org.uk/) \- Access the very latest in technology, arts and digital development through holiday workshops for children and young people, Saturday afternoon digital art sessions and Wednesday evening maker classes.

## Activity directory

From kayaking to boxing and dancing to karate, you'll find a whole host of activities just for young people, run by Wigan Council, partner organisations and some local community groups.

* [Take a look at our list of activities](/LINC2/Things-to-do/Things-to-do.aspx "Things to do").

# Domestic abuse

Browser does not support script.

[Leave website](#)

![Domestic abuse banner](/Images/Resident/Crime/Domestic-abuse-banner.png)

* [What is domestic abuse?Help to understand the different forms of abuse](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/What-is-DA.aspx)
* [Get supportAdvice and support for women and men experiencing domestic abuse](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/Get-support-DA.aspx)
* [Support for friends and familyHow to spot the signs of abuse and where to get support](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/Support-for-family-friends-DA.aspx)
* [Support if you use abuseAdvice and support if you use abuse in your relationship](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/Support-if-you-use-abuse-DA.aspx)
* [How to use the internet discretelyHow to hide your online activity and delete your browsing history](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/Online-protection-DA.aspx)
* [Wigan Borough Domestic Abuse ServiceSupport, advice and counselling for those affected by domestic abuse](https://diasdvc.org/)

## More in this section

* [Domestic Abuse Strategy](http://www.wigan.gov.uk/Council/Partnerships/Building-Stronger-Communities-Partnership.aspx "Domestic Abuse Strategy")

## [Open data](/Council/DataProtection-FOI-Stats/Open-Data.aspx "Open data")

 Open Data is information held by Wigan Council which is freely available to view and be used by the public.

## [Open register](/Council/Voting-and-Elections/Open-register.aspx "Open register")

 Remove yourself from or add yourself back on to the open version of the electoral register \- formerly known as the edited register.

All news releases are issued by the council's Public Relations team. For general media and press enquiries, email [pr@wigan.gov.uk](mailto:pr@wigan.gov.uk "mailto:pr@wigan.gov.uk") or ring the Press Office on 01942 828050, 01942 404055, 01942 827106 or 01942 486096\. Wigan Council welcomes film and TV crews to our beautiful borough. For enquiries to film on council land, [see further information](/Council/Contact-us/Filming-in-Wigan-Borough.aspx "Filming in Wigan Borough").

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Bins and recycling](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Go to Bins and recycling from here")/Waste and recycling centres

# Waste and recycling centres

Change in hours →   

As of Sunday the 31st of March, the Wigan Recycling Centres will be reverting to the summer hours of 8am till 7:45pm.

The site will be closed Christmas Day, Boxing Day, and New Year's Day.

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

**Access Restrictions**

* Only adults to unload the vehicle. Please keep children and pets inside the vehicle
* A driving licence is required for proof of Wigan Borough residency
* Vehicles over 3\.5 tonnes will not be allowed at any of the Recycling centres
* Vehicles will not be allowed to use a tipping mechanism at any of the Recycling Centres, vehicles must be manually unloaded
* Trailers over 4 metres will not be allowed at any of the Recycling Centres
* Trailers over 3 metres long will not be allowed at Slag Lane or Chanters Recycling Centre
* Anyone deemed to be using abusive or intimidating behaviour will not be allowed to use any of the Recycling Centres
* Pedestrians will not be allowed to carry waste onto any of the Recycling Centres
* 5 mph speed limits apply at all sites
* 2 metre vehicle height restriction
* Speed bumps in use on site.

**Please Note:**Due to safety concerns, queueing outside of the site will be restricted, residents may be asked to leave and return at a later time.

## Slag Lane and Chanters Recycling Centres

Household waste will be accepted in:

* A car with or without a single axle trailer up to 3 metres long\*
* A van under 3\.5 tonnes with or without a single axle trailer up to 3 metres long\* with a permit
* A car or van under 3\.5 tonnes with a twin axle trailer (up to 3m long) with a permit.

\*Trailer length is measured from the hitch to the end of the trailer.

**Please Note:** Residents visiting Slag Lane are advised to approach from the Lowton side.

## Kirkless Recycling Centre

Household waste will be accepted in:

* A car with or without a single axle trailer up to 4 metres long\*
* A van under 3\.5 tonnes with or without a single axle trailer up to 4 metres long\* with a permit
* A car or van under 3\.5 tonnes with a twin axle trailer (up to 4m long) with a permit.

\*Trailer length is measured from the hitch to the end of the trailer.

### Waste recycling permit scheme

A valid permit must be obtained online via the Wigan Council website. You will receive confirmation that your permit is being processed and then your waste permit will be sent to your email address within two hours.

Waste permits are valid for one visit only within seven days of issuing. Each household is entitled to 12 permits within a 12 month period, starting from the date the first permit is requested. The number of permits issued to any vehicle or premises will be monitored.

For the purpose of this permit scheme a van shall be deemed to be:

* Any vehicle without side or rear windows or seats in rear
* Any ‘flat back’ vehicle
* Any ‘pick up’ vehicle, with or without detachable cover to rear load area
* Any vehicle with ‘blanked out’ rear windows.

**Please note:** Access to sites will be removed for people misusing the waste recycling permits.

## Apply for a waste recycling permit

Permits can be applied for on the same day you wish to take your waste, as they will be sent to your computer or mobile device within 2 hours of making your order online.

A waste permit allows you **ONE** visit to the recycling centre. You can request 2 types of permits:

* [Apply for a standard waste permit](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/default.aspx?form=standardwastepermit "Apply for a standard waste permit")
* [Apply for a garden waste permit](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/default.aspx?form=gardenwastepermit "Apply for a garden waste permit") (Only for very large gardens that can demonstrate that they regularly generate large amounts of garden waste throughout the year)\*
* [Request to be re\-sent an existing waste permit](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/default.aspx?form=reissuewastepermit "Request to be re-sent an existing permit") (as long as the permit has not already expired or previously been used).

\*If you only have a small amount of garden waste which exceeds one bins worth, then please apply for a standard waste permit, and select garden waste from the drop\-down menu.

To find out more:

* [View our waste permit frequently asked questions (FAQs)](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-permit-FAQs.aspx "Waste permit FAQs")
* [Read our waste permit terms and conditions](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/HWRC-Terms-and-Conditions.aspx "Waste and recycling centre permits T&Cs").

### Hire vehicles

Hire your vehicle then order your free waste recycling permit. When attending the recycling centre, please take your hire vehicle documents, waste permit and driving licence with you.

## Locations

Wigan Borough has three waste and recycling centres in the following locations:

KirklessMakerfield Way, Higher Ince, WN2 2PR01942 825755

Slag LaneLeigh, WA3 1BZ01942 261633

Chanters Chanters Industrial Estate, Atherton, M46 9BP01942 897949

**Opening hours (inc. Bank Holidays):**

* Summer \- everyday, 8am to 7:45pm (from last Sunday in March)
* Winter \- everyday, 9am to 5:45pm (from last Sunday in October)

**Site closed:** Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Year's Day.

Abusive behaviour towards members of staff will not be tolerated and may result in being denied access to any of the recycling centres.

Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) and CCTV is in place across all sites to monitor vehicle visits.

## Items that can be recycled at the centres

To ensure your items are recycled correctly, please separate your waste before you visit a recycling centre.

### Paper, Glass, Plastic

* Paper
* Card (no glitter)
* Cardboard
* Telephone directories
* Books
* Glass bottles and jars
* Plastic bottles, pots and tubs
* Hard plastics (Mop buckets, washing up bowls, plastic garden chairs etc.)
* Media (CDs, DVDs, Blu\-ray)

### Foil, Cans, Metal

* Foil
* Cans
* Aerosols
* Scrap metal (ferrous and non\-ferrous)

### Appliances, Bulbs, Batteries

* Small electrical appliances (kettles, toasters etc.) **Please ensure any batteries are removed and recycled separately.**
* Large domestic appliances (washing machines, dryers etc.)
* Fridges and freezers (any domestic fridge/freezer up to maximum size of American\-style upright fridge) **Please remove all items from fridge/freezers beforehand.**
* Televisions and computer monitors
* Mobile phones
* Fluorescent tubes
* Eco bulbs and traditional bulbs
* Household batteries (Place in battery container, seek assistance from a member of staff if needed)

### Building materials, Garden

* Plasterboard (monitoring system in place)
* Wood and timber
* Garden waste (no food waste \- please place in your green bin)
* Soil, hardcore and rubble (monitoring system in place). Rubble also includes:   
Bricks/Breeze Blocks   
Concrete  
Gravel  
Paving Slabs  
Sanitaryware (ceramic, porcelain, toilet, sink, shower trays, bidets, cisterns etc.)  
Slates  
Stone  
Tarmac  
Tiles  
Crockery

### Hazardous waste

* Asbestos (only accepted at Kirkless, you must first [arrange an appointment](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Hazardous-waste.aspx "Hazardous waste"))
* Pesticide (only accepted at Kirkless, you must first [check they are legal for use](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Hazardous-waste.aspx "Hazardous waste"))
* Gas bottles
* Paint
* Chemicals (only accepted at Kirkless)

### Car

* Car batteries
* Used engine oil
* Tyres (maximum of 4 x car tyres)

### Other

* Mixed textiles, clothes and duvets
* Mattresses
* Carpets
* Shoes
* Cooking oil
* Print cartridges

**Please note:** Petrol and Diesel are **not** accepted at any of the recycling centres.

## Battery Recycling

Batteries are often found in products like laptops, tablets, mobile phones, radio\-controlled toys, Bluetooth devices, shavers, electric toothbrushes, power tools, scooters, kid’s plastic toys, remotes controls, and even e\-cigarettes etc.

* The research suggests that at least 25% of the UK population appear to be binning batteries, and nearly a third (29%) of those people who dispose of electrical items have put at least one of them in a household bin or the wrong recycling container in the past year
* Many people are unaware that there are embedded batteries in some electrical waste and the electrical items most commonly disposed of within the last year are electric toothbrushes (39% of respondents), device charger/powerbank (24%) and shavers/trimmers (22%). Other items commonly disposed of included electric toys, power tools, e\-cigarettes and Bluetooth earbuds
* Of the people who throw batteries in the bin, most say they don’t know what to do with them, and only 10% of those that bin batteries are aware of the fire risk. Those binning batteries appear more likely to be younger and female, particularly for loose batteries
* People who are aware, or who are made aware, of the fire risk are less likely to bin batteries.

Batteries **SHOULD NOT** be disposed of in any of the kerbside bins. Find your nearest battery recycling outlet from the [Recycle Now Locator (external link)](https://www.recyclenow.com/recycling-locator).

## Local recycling points

* [Find a local recycling point (external link)](https://www.recyclenow.com/recycling-locator "Local recycling points")

### Full or damaged recycling points

If you find a recycling point that is full or damaged, you should report it to the relevant organisation. See contact details below:

* The glass recycling banks are serviced by Glass Recycling (UK), call 01226 727298 or email [bob@glassrecycle.co.uk](mailto:bob@glassrecycle.co.uk)
* Clothing/shoe banks are serviced by different charities and the contact details should be displayed on the bank itself. If there are no contact details provided, you can [contact the waste and recycling team](/Contacts/Recycling.aspx "Recycling") with the location of the bank and the type of recycling it's used for
* Can recycling banks are serviced by Wigan Council, you can [contact the waste and recycling team](/Contacts/Recycling.aspx "Recycling") with the location of the bank.

## Customer Satisfaction Survey

Your opinions about our service are very important to us.

[Complete our online customer satisfaction survey (external link)](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=ov4gjoj1OUW2LNXL1JFMtuUu3KOnLslMsKSWrkoCcv9URjNUNjFPV1E1NUQ0UUtVWko3STI1TlpITSQlQCN0PWcu). The survey should take a few minutes to complete and will help us to improve the services we deliver to you.

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Apply for a standard waste permit](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/default.aspx?form=standardwastepermit "Go to the Apply for a standard waste permit page")
2. [Apply for a garden waste permit (Large garden)](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/default.aspx?form=gardenwastepermit "Go to the Apply for a garden waste permit (Large garden) page")
3. [Request to be re\-sent an existing permit](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/default.aspx?form=reissuewastepermit "Go to the Request to be re-sent an existing permit page")
4. [Local recycling points](https://www.recycle-more.co.uk/ "Go to the Local recycling points page")

# A\-Z

* [A](/A-Z.aspx?WiganAtoZ_AtoZLetter=A "33 records to display")

Displaying 1 to 34 of 34

 Announce the name of your new baby or welcome a child into your family with a ceremony for all your family.

 A movement to encourage people to be kind and to think about how they can make a difference.

 The latest updates on our leisure centres and wellbeing services.

 Be Well Wigan is your hub for all leisure services \- book a class, gym, swim or activity, get membership and much more.

## [Be Well \- System changes and updates](/BeWell/FAQs.aspx "Be Well - System changes and updates")

 The latest updates on our leisure centres and wellbeing services.

 Get outdoors with our wide range of land and water based activities for families, schools and independent groups.

## [Becoming more active](/BeWell/Health-Services/Health-Advice/Becoming-more-active.aspx "Becoming more active")

 Becoming more active can have a major positive impact on how you feel, both physically and mentally.

 Sign up to the Believe in Business Charter, find out how we can support you and access the online business directory

## [Believe in Business Festival](/Business/Business-Support/Business-Festival.aspx "Believe in Business Festival")

 The festival will highlight the support that is available across Greater Manchester, focusing on local businesses sharing stories to inspire and encourage how to grow their business.

## [Benefit fraud](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Benefit-fraud.aspx "Benefit fraud")

 Help us to identify those people who falsely claim Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit.

 Housing Benefits, Council Tax Reduction, free school meals, report a change in circumstances and more.

 Organisations and services available to help those who have experienced bereavement.

## [Big Listening Festival](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Our-Town/Big-Listening-Festival/Index.aspx "Big Listening Festival")

 We listened to thousands of your views and suggestions to help us refresh the Deal 2030 \- here's how it's helping us shape the borough.

## [Bins and recycling](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Bins and recycling")

 Which bin to use, putting your bin out, bin collection dates, missed bins, replacement bins, bulky item collections, finding a recycling centre and more.

## [Births](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Births/Registering-a-birth.aspx "Births")

## [Black History Month](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Black-History-Month/Index.aspx "Black History Month")

 Celebrating black British history, the achievements of Britain's black communities, being a good ally and links to further reading and viewing.

## [Blue Badges](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Blue-Badge-permit/Blue-Badges.aspx "Blue Badges")

## [Blue Plaque Scheme](/Resident/Museums-archives/Wigan-Archives/Blue-Plaque-Scheme.aspx "Blue Plaque Scheme")

 A permanent sign to commemorate a link between a location and a famous person, event, or former building.

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Council](/Council/index.aspx "Go to Council from here")/[The Deal](/Council/The-Deal/index.aspx "Go to The Deal from here")/Volunteering

# Volunteering

One of the greatest gifts you can give is your time...
People volunteer for many different reasons. At Wigan Council we support volunteers to contribute to the work we do as well as help community organisations to recruit volunteers across the borough. You'll find a range of volunteering opportunities on the Wigan Borough Volunteering Hub, where you can:

* Register and apply for volunteer roles
* Submit and advertise a volunteer opportunity if you're a community group.

[Find out more by visiting the Wigan Borough Volunteering Hub (external link)](https://www.wiganboroughvolunteerhub.co.uk/).

* [People and the CommunityHelp support a range of schemes in the borough including youth justice, mentoring, community work and more](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/People-and-the-community/index.aspx)
* [EnvironmentWorking with groups to support environmentally friendly schemes](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Environment/index.aspx)
* [Culture and leisureWork in a community library, the museum or archives](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Culture-and-Leisure/index.aspx)
* [Health and wellbeingBecome a champion to promote living well and cancer awareness](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Health/index.aspx)
* [SchoolsVolunteer your time to help children learn and grow at school](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Schools/index.aspx)
 * [Training for volunteersA range of training opportunities are available for volunteers](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Training-for-volunteers.aspx)

## More in this section

* [DBS checks](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/DBS-checks.aspx "DBS checks")
* [Volunteer to be a TechMate](http://www.wigan.gov.uk/Council/Digital-Wigan/Volunteer-to-be-a-TechMate.aspx "Volunteer to be a TechMate")
* [Volunteer case studies](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Volunteer-case-studies.aspx "Volunteer case studies")
