[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Bins and recycling](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Go to Bins and recycling from here")/Report a missed bin

# Report a missed bin

Before you report a missed bin → 
**[Check out our list of missed streets](#Listmissedstreets)** \- If your street is on our list then you do not need to report your missed bin. Just leave your bin out at its usual collection point and we will collect it as soon as possible.

We update the missed streets list at 5pm every collection day, so please check the list after 5pm, before reporting a missed bin.

**Please help us improve our service by numbering your bins.**

## What to do about a missed bin

**If your bin has not been collected on your scheduled collection day, and your street is not recorded on the [missed streets list](#Listmissedstreets), you can report it as missed.**

**Before you report a missed bin**,  [check out our list of missed streets](#Listmissedstreets). If your street is on our list then you do not need to report your missed bin. Just leave your bin out at it's usual collection point and we will collect it as soon as possible.

**We update the missed streets list at 5pm every collection day, so please check the list after 5pm, before reporting a missed bin.**

If you want to report a missed bin, you must do so within **48 hours** of your collection day and **after 8pm** on the collection day itself (when the crews have completed their rounds).

## Do NOT report a missed bin if:

* You did not put your bin out before 6\.30am on your scheduled collection day (see our [guidance on putting your bins out](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Putting-your-bin-out-for-collection.aspx "Putting your bin out for collection"))
* Your bin contains incorrect materials or is too heavy (please see the sticker on your bin). You **must** remove any incorrect materials or heavy items from your bin for your next scheduled collection or we **will not** be able to empty it.

You can [complete our online form to report a missed bin](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/MissedBins/Default.aspx "Report missed bin").

### Reporting a missed collection for properties with shared bins

If you are reporting a missed collection for a property with shared bins please complete the [Report a missed collection at a shared property](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/xfp/form/531) form to report the issue to waste services.

## What happens next?

Once you've submitted your missed bin request online, you will receive a successful submission message and a confirmation email of your report.

If you don’t receive either, it is likely that you were prevented from completing the report as you were not within the required timeframe.

You will need to put your bin out from the following Monday before 6:30am and we will return to collect it one of the days that week.

## Why your bin wasn't collected

There can be a number of reasons why your bin wasn't collected, including:

* Contaminated bins
* Blocked access
* Vehicle breakdown
* Adverse weather conditions
* Unforeseen circumstances.

## List of missed streets

Below is a list of streets where bin collections have been missed. These bins will be collected as soon as possible, including Saturday if necessary. 

**We update the missed streets list at 5pm every collection day, so please check the list after 5pm, before reporting a missed bin.**

**If your street is listed below, you do not need to report a missed bin**. Please leave your bin at your usual bin collection point and we will aim to return as soon as possible.

If your street is not listed below and you've checked the list after 5pm on your collection day, [see what to do about a missed bin](#Whattodomissedbin).

# Planning

page_content='Search and comment on planning applications

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Planning and building control](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/index.aspx "Go to Planning and building control from here")/[Planning](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Index.aspx "Go to Planning from here")/Search and comment on planning applications

# Search and comment on planning applications

**Please be aware that the our online planning application comments system is NOT linked to MyAccount. You will need to register separately to use the system and make your comments.**

To search our database of planning applications you will need an address or the details of the application.

Our database allows you to:

* Search for planning applications
* Track the progress of an application
* View scanned application forms, drawings, decision notices and the conditions/reasons for the decision for applications lodged with the Council
* View locations of planning and building control applications on a map
* Search for appeals lodged and decided
* Comment on pending applications and view officer reports
* Generate a weekly or monthly list of applications.

See our [privacy notices](/Council/DataProtection-FOI-Stats/Privacy-notices/Privacy-Notices-for-all-services.aspx "Privacy notices for all council services") to find out how we collect, use and share your personal information.

## Get started

You will need to register on the system if you wish to save any searches, receive email notifications of pending applications in your area or share your comments.

### Commenting on a planning application

Please be aware that your comments will appear online. With this in mind, please **DO NOT**:

* Use any personal names \- please use words such as applicant, neighbour etc
* Provide information you or others wouldn't want to be made public, e.g. financial ,medical information etc
* Contain any material which is defamatory of any person
* Be offensive, inflammatory, discriminatory, violent, threatening or libellous in your comments, these will not be considered by the case officer
* Be threatening, abusive or invade another's privacy, or cause annoyance, inconvenience or needless anxiety
* Provide a signature \- these are not required and do not add weight to comments received
* Impersonate any person, or to misrepresent your identity or affiliation with any person
* Promote sexually explicit material
* Promote discrimination based on race, sex, religion, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, or age
* Infringe any copyright, database right or trade mark of any other person
* Promote any illegal activity or violence.

Should you wish to make comments on a planning application, please be aware that the comment page will “time out” after approximately 30 minutes of inactivity. To ensure your comment isn’t lost, it is advisable to create an electronic draft beforehand then paste your comments into the appropriate field.

Please also note that there is a 2000 character limit for an online comment. Should your comment exceed this amount please email your document to [planning@wigan.gov.uk](mailto:planning@wigan.gov.uk "mailto:planning@wigan.gov.uk") and a member of the team will upload the comment for you onto the planning application.

* [Search, track and comment on planning applications](https://planning.wigan.gov.uk/online-applications/ "Idox Public Access")

See our [user guide](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning-guidance/User-Guide-Idox-Public-Access-system.pdf "User Guide Idox Public Access system") for further details on how to use the system.

Please be aware that by using the search you agree to the [Council's disclaimer](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Disclaimer.aspx "Disclaimer").

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Search and comment on planning applications](https://planning.wigan.gov.uk/online-applications/ "Go to the Search and comment on planning applications page")

page_content='Anti\-social behaviour (ASB)

Browser does not support script.

[Skip to content](#L3_MainContentPlaceholder)

  [Login](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk) 

[Wigan Council](/index.aspx)

* [Resident](/index.aspx)

[Emergency contact](https://www.wigan.gov.uk/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Emergencies.aspx "Emergency contact")

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Crime and emergencies](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Crime-and-emergencies.aspx "Go to Crime and emergencies from here")/[Anti\-social behaviour](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/ASB/Index.aspx "Go to Anti-social behaviour from here")/Anti\-social behaviour (ASB)

# Anti\-social behaviour (ASB)

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

Anti\-social behaviour (ASB) includes a wide range of unacceptable behaviour that affects the quality of life for residents and others living or working in the community. This behaviour is often a criminal offence and therefore a matter for the Police.

However, we often receive complaints about things that are not anti\-social but are more about a different style of living.

Take a look at the table below to find out what is and is not ASB:

Is it anti\-social behaviour?
| What is ASB? | What is NOT ASB? |
| --- | --- |
| [Domestic violence and abuse](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/Index.aspx "Domestic abuse") \- Report to the police first | Cooking smells |
| Physical violence \- Report to the police first | DIY in reasonable hours |
| [Hate\-related incidents](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Hate-Crime.aspx "Hate crime") (eg based on race, sexual orientation, gender, disability or belief) \- Report to the police first | Minor car repairs |
| Verbal abuse, harassment, intimidation or threatening behaviour \- Report to the police first | Young people gathering socially |
| Vandalism and damage to properties \- Report to the police first | Children playing in the street, including ball games |
| Prostitution, sexual acts or kerb crawling \- Report to the police first | Parking disputes |
| Criminal behaviour including using/dealing drugs \- Report to the police first | Civil disputes between neighbours (eg boundary issues or shared driveways) |
| Misuse of open spaces, public areas or loitering, including begging and off\-road use of vehicles \- Report to the police first | Disputes over social media |
| [Noise complaints](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Noise/index.aspx "Noise nuisance - residential") | Lifestyle differences |
| Problem Neighbours | Bonfires and BBQ’s |
|  | One off house parties |

If any of the above examples listed as 'NOT ASB' are having a harmful impact on a person because they are vulnerable, then we may investigate further.

## How do I report anti\-social behaviour?

To report anti\-social behaviour, you will need to:

* Visit '[How to report ASB](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/ASB/How-to-report-anti-social-behaviour.aspx "How to report anti-social behaviour")' to find out what steps to follow when reporting an issue.

If someone is in immediate danger, please call 999 now.

Contact the Wigan safeguarding teams if you're concerned about the [welfare of a neighbour](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/report-abuse-or-neglect-of-a-vulnerable-adult.aspx "Report abuse/neglect of a vulnerable adult") or if you're worried about the [safety of a child](http://www.wiganlscb.com/Report-it/index.aspx).

If it's not an emergency but a crime\-related incident contact Greater Manchester Police by calling 101 or [reporting it online (external link)](https://www.gmp.police.uk/).

If you want to provide information about an incident anonymously, report it to [CrimeStoppers online](https://crimestoppers-uk.org/) or call 0800 555111\.

## Anti\-social behaviour case review

* If you have reported a similar or related incident 3 times in the last 6 months you can ask us to [review the case](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/ASB/ASB-Case-Review.aspx "Anti-social behaviour case review (also known as Community Trigger)").

## What if I live in a housing association property?

If you are a housing association tenant, you can report ASB to your landlord:

* [Jigsaw Homes North](https://north.jigsawhomes.org.uk/ "Jigsaw Homes North") \- call 0300 111 1133 or email [info@jigsawhomes.org.uk](mailto:info@jigsawhomes.org.uk)
* [Anchor Trust](https://www.anchor.org.uk/) \- call 0800 731 2020 or email [contact@anchor.org.uk](mailto:contact@anchor.org.uk)
* [Places for People](https://www.placesforpeople.co.uk/) \- call 0845 850 9571 or email [customerservicecentre@placesforpeople.co.uk](mailto:customerservicecentre@placesforpeople.co.uk)
* [Riverside Housing Association](https://www.riverside.org.uk/) \- call 0845 111 0000 or email [info@riverside.org.uk](mailto:info@riverside.org.uk)
* [Your Housing Group](https://www.yourhousinggroup.co.uk/) \- call 0345 345 0272 or email [response@yourhousinggroup.co.uk](mailto:response@yourhousinggroup.co.uk)

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Report anti\-social behaviour through MyAccount](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/ "Go to the Report anti-social behaviour through MyAccount page")
2. [Report anti\-social behaviour (unregistered user)](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/xfp/form/263 "Go to the Report anti-social behaviour (unregistered user) page")

Displaying 1 to 3 of 3

## [UK Shared Prosperity Fund (UKSPF)](/Council/Projects/Funding/UK-Shared-Prosperity-Fund.aspx "UK Shared Prosperity Fund (UKSPF)")

 Wigan Council will receive just over £3m over three years through the UKSPF Communities and Place investment priority.

## [Underage sales](/Resident/Consumer-Advice/Trading-Standards/UnderAgeSales.aspx "Underage sales")

 Trading Standards carry out visits to all shops that sell age\-restricted products to help them make sure they don't break the law.

## [Universal Credit](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Universal-Credit.aspx "Universal Credit")

 Bringing together a range of working age benefits into a single payment.

Displaying 1 to 3 of 3

# Winter services and advice

## Gritting

![gritting](/Images/Council/Winter/gritting.jpg)
* [Gritting and snow clearance](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Gritting-and-snow-clearance.aspx "Gritting and snow clearance")
* [Gritting route map](https://experience.arcgis.com/experience/86d2e2ebc4604943bd57245552b8b87c "Highway winter service map")
* [Winter highway maintenance](/Council/Winter/Winter-Maintenance.aspx "Winter highway maintenance")
* [Frequently asked questions](/Council/Winter/Frequently-asked-questions.aspx "Frequently asked questions").

## Bin collections

![winter bins 2](/Images/Council/Winter/winter-bins-2.gif)
* [When is my bin collected?](https://apps.wigan.gov.uk/MyNeighbourhood/ "Bin collection dates")
* [Bins and recycling information](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Bins and Recycling")
* [Waste and recycling centres](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres")

## Contact us

![contact](/Images/Council/Winter/contact.png)
* [Emergency contact information](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Emergencies.aspx "Emergency Contacts")
* Latest news on [Facebook (external link)](https://www.facebook.com/WiganCouncilOnline)
* Latest news on [Twitter (external link)](https://twitter.com/wigancouncil)

## School closures

![School-closure](/Images/Council/Winter/School-closure.jpg)
* Schools should inform parents about any closures
* [Find school contact/website details](https://apps.wigan.gov.uk/schools/)

## Travel and weather

![weather](/Images/Council/Winter/weather.jpg)
* [Met Office weather (external link)](https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/ "Met Office")
* [Planet Radio \- Traffic (external link)](https://planetradio.co.uk/greatest-hits/)
* [Transport for Greater Manchester (external link)](https://tfgm.com/ "Transport for Greater Manchester")
* [National Rail (external link)](https://www.nationalrail.co.uk/status-and-disruptions/)
* [Crossing a river at a ford (external link)](https://www.theaa.com/driving-advice/seasonal/crossing-a-ford "The AA - Crossing a river at a ford")
* [National Flood Resilience Review (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-flood-resilience-review "National Flood Resilience Review")

## Warmer homes

![Warm-homes](/Images/Council/Winter/Warm-homes.jpg)
* [Affordable Warmth Access Referral Mechanism (AWARM plus)](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Housing/Affordable-Warmth-Access-Referral-Mechanism.pdf "Affordable Warmth Access Referral Mechanism")
* [Warm homes \- help with your fuel bills](/Resident/Housing/Warm-homes/Index.aspx "Warm homes")
* [Energy Saving Trust (external link)](https://energysavingtrust.org.uk/)
* [Keep Warm, Keep Well (external link)](https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/seasonal-health/keep-warm-keep-well/)
* [Services for owner occupiers and private tenants](/Resident/Housing/Private-Housing/Services-for-owner-occupiers-and-private-tenants.aspx "Services for owner occupiers and private tenants")

## General winter advice

![Winter-advice](/Images/Council/Winter/Winter-advice.jpg)
* [Get winter ready \- Met Office advice (external link)](https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/weather/warnings-and-advice/seasonal-advice)
* [How to get your home and property winter ready \- Met Office (external link)](https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/weather/warnings-and-advice/seasonal-advice/your-home/protecting-your-property-from-winter-weather)
* [Help for rough sleepers](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Homelessness/HelpforRoughSleepers.aspx "Help for Rough Sleepers")
* [Sheltered housing](/Resident/Housing/Homes-for-older-people/index.aspx "Sheltered Housing")
* [NHS Winter health advice (external link)](https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/healthy-body/keep-warm-keep-well/)
* [Age UK Spread the Warmth (external link)](https://www.ageuk.org.uk/information-advice/travel-hobbies/finding-your-feet/spread-the-warmth/)

## Local radio

![radio](/Images/Council/Winter/radio.jpg)
* Listen to local radio stations for updates on travel, weather and school closures:
* [BBC Radio Manchester (95\.1\) (external link)](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/live:bbc_radio_manchester)

# Council Tax

* [Pay your Council TaxPay your bill online and set up a direct debit](/Resident/Council-Tax/Pay-your-Council-Tax/Pay-your-Council-Tax.aspx)
* [View your Council Tax accountLogin to MyAccount to view your latest balance and payments](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/)
* [Struggling to pay your Council Tax?Get advice and support if you're finding it difficult to pay](/Resident/Council-Tax/Having-problems-paying-your-bill.aspx)
* [Report a changeTell us if you change address, someone leaves/joins your household or passes away, update account details and more](/Resident/Council-Tax/Report-a-change/Index.aspx)
* [Discounts, reductions and exemptionsApply and find out if you're entitled to Council Tax discounts, reductions and exemptions](/Resident/Council-Tax/Discounts-reductions-and-exemptions/Discounts-reductions-and-exemptions.aspx)
* [Who should payFind out who is responsible for paying Council Tax](/Resident/Council-Tax/Who-has-to-pay.aspx)
* [How much is my Council Tax?Find out your valuation band](/Resident/Council-Tax/How-much-is-my-Council-tax/Counci-tax-valuation-bands.aspx)
* [AppealsFind out what you need to do if you do not agree with a decision we have made](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Disputes-and-appeals/index.aspx)
* [Refund requestApply for a refund if you have overpaid your Council Tax](/Resident/Council-Tax/Pay-your-Council-Tax/Refunds.aspx)

## [Data and statistics](/Council/Data-Statistics/Data-Statistics.aspx "Data and statistics")

 Providing Census 2011 information and in\-depth knowledge and data for the communities within the borough.

## [Day opportunities for people with dementia](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Day-opportunities/Index.aspx "Day opportunities for people with dementia")

 Offering people with dementia opportunities to take part in therapeutic and stimulating activities.

## [Deal for Communities Investment Fund](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Funding/Deal-for-Communities-Investment-Fund.aspx "Deal for Communities Investment Fund")

 Find out how the Deal for Communities Investment Fund has helped organisations in the borough.

## [Deaths](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Deaths.aspx "Deaths")

 Registering a death, bereavement support and the tell us once service.

## [Dementia](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/dementia/dementia.aspx "Dementia")

 What dementia is, support for people with dementia and carers, staying say and useful organisations and resources.

## [Designated Clinical Officer (DCO) for SEND](/Resident/Education/Special-Educational-Needs-and-Disability/Local-Offer/Parent/Health/Health-services/Designated-Clinical-Officer.aspx "Designated Clinical Officer (DCO) for SEND")

 The DCO ensures that health services are fully engaged and meeting their requirements around SEND and legislation across Wigan borough.

## [Developer Hub](/Business/Property-and-Land/Developer-hub/Index.aspx "Developer Hub")

 An online tool to help developers with all aspects of the housing development process.

## [Development Plan](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Policies-and-Guidance/Development-Plan.aspx "Development Plan")

 Development Plan

## [Digital and ICT skills](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-Learning/Digital-and-ICT-skills.aspx "Digital and ICT skills")

 Digital skills are essential, from supporting your working life to trying to book a doctor's appointment. Our free Digital Skills and EDSQ courses can help you develop your skills for day to day life, work and beyond.

## [Digital Communities Partnership](/Council/Digital-Wigan/Digital-communities-partnership/Index.aspx "Digital Communities Partnership")

 A group of local community organisations offering a variety of courses and learning opportunities for all age ranges across Wigan borough

## [Digital strategy](/Council/Strategies-Plans-and-Policies/Digital-strategy.aspx "Digital strategy")

 Our digital strategy to empower people and businesses in the digital age.

## [Digital support for businesses](/Business/Business-Support/Advice/Digital-support.aspx "Digital support for businesses")

 Our Digital Advisor is available to support your business to become more digital savvy and upskill your workforce.

## [Disabled parking](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Disabled-parking.aspx "Disabled parking")

 Apply for or renew a blue badge, where to park and getting disabled bay markings outside your home.

## [Disabled parking bays](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Disabled-parking-bay-application.aspx "Disabled parking bays")

 If a resident is disabled, they may apply to have an advisory parking bay marked on the highway outside their home if they meet the criteria.

## [Discounts, reductions and exemptions](/Resident/Council-Tax/Discounts-reductions-and-exemptions/Discounts-reductions-and-exemptions.aspx "Discounts, reductions and exemptions")

 Apply and find out if you are entitled to any council tax discounts, reductions and exemptions.

## [Disputes and appeals](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Disputes-and-appeals/index.aspx "Disputes and appeals")

 If you don't agree with a decision we have made on your Council Tax, Housing Benefit or Council Tax Reduction you can raise a dispute or appeal.

## [Dog control](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Dogs/Dog-control.aspx "Dog control")

 A Public Spaces Protection Order (PSPO) has now been put in place to assist dog owners to behave responsibly in the whole of the Wigan borough

## [Dogs](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Dogs/Dogs.aspx "Dogs")

 Report any dog issues \- lost, stray, dangerous dogs, information on dog fouling.

## [Domestic abuse](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Domestic-abuse/Index.aspx "Domestic abuse")

 What it is, how to get support for women and men, emergency contacts, your legal rights and more.

## [Domestic Homicide Review (DHR)](/Council/Strategies-Plans-and-Policies/Domestic-Homicide-Review.aspx "Domestic Homicide Review (DHR)")

 Reviewing the circumstances of the death of a person aged 16 or over from violence, abuse or neglect.

## [Drains, sewers and culverts](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Flooding/Drains-and-sewers.aspx "Drains, sewers and culverts")

 Help and advice on who is responsible for drains, sewers and culverts in Wigan Borough.

## [Driveway access](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Driveway-access.aspx "Driveway access")

 What to do if people park across your driveway, apply to construct dropped kerbs or have driveway access markings.

## [Drug and alcohol treatment \- young people](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Young-peoples-drug-and-alcohol-team.aspx "Drug and alcohol treatment - young people")

 Helping young people aged 18 and under to address risky behaviour linked to substance misuse.

## [Drug support](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/fit-and-well/Drug-support.aspx "Drug support")

 Access support and treatment for adults concerned about their own or someone else's drug problem.

## [Duke of Edinburgh's Award](http://www.wigan.gov.uk/LINC2/Things-to-do/Activities/Duke-of-Edinburghs-Award.aspx "Duke of Edinburgh's Award")

 Open to all young people aged 14\-24, the Duke of Edinburgh's Award lets you get involved in exciting activities.

## [Land and property availability](/Business/Property-and-Land/LandandPropList.aspx "Land and property availability")

 Retail, industrial and commercial property, as well as land and development opportunities available for sale or to let.

## [Land charges](/Business/Property-and-Land/Land-Charges/index.aspx "Land charges")

 Request to search local property and land registers.

## [Land drainage](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Flooding/land-drainage.aspx "Land drainage")

 Responsibilities of land owners to maintain land drains (watercourses) or field drains where they cross or border their land.

## [Land ownership enquiries](/Business/Property-and-Land/Land-ownership.aspx "Land ownership enquiries")

 Contact us about council owned land or properties \- if there is a problem or if you wish to buy or rent it.

## [Landlord Housing Benefit Portal](/Business/Property-and-Land/Private-Landlords/Landlord-Portal.aspx "Landlord Housing Benefit Portal")

 View your housing benefit payment online.

## [Landlords](/Business/Property-and-Land/Private-Landlords/index.aspx "Landlords")

 Find out if you need a licence, what your landlord duties are and sign up to Landlord Hub, how to use the landlord portal and more.

## [Lawful Development Certificate \- find out if you need planning permission](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Lawful-Development-Certificate.aspx "Lawful Development Certificate - find out if you need planning permission")

 Find out if you need planning permission by applying for a lawful development certificate

## [Lead Professional Support Documents](/Business/Professionals/Early-Help/Early-Help-policies-and-strategies/Lead-Professional-Support-Documents.aspx "Lead Professional Support Documents")

 Lead Professional Support Documents

## [Leading Early Years Excellence Partnership (LEyEP)](/Business/Professionals/LEyEP/index.aspx "Leading Early Years Excellence Partnership (LEyEP)")

 Services to support and raise the quality of Early Years provision and practice across Wigan, and the wider North West region.

## [Learner Services Fees](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-Learning/Learner-Services.aspx "Learner Services Fees")

 Wigan Adult Learning and Skills aims to provide as much free provision for as many residents of the borough as possible, where there is an education or skills gap.

## [Learning, courses and training](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-community-learning.aspx "Learning, courses and training")

 Flexible learning, courses and training for all ages to help you build your skills.

## [Lease your property to the Council](/Business/Property-and-Land/Private-Landlords/Ethical-lettings-agency.aspx "Lease your property to the Council")

 Find out about the Council's Ethical Lettings Agency for local landlords, investors and developers.

## [Leigh Bike Library at Leigh Youth Hub](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Travel/Leigh-Bike-Library.aspx "Leigh Bike Library at Leigh Youth Hub")

 Based at the Leigh Youth Hub at Leigh Sports Village, our service allows you to loan bikes, helmets, locks and other cycling equipment absolutely FREE of charge.

## [Leigh Life Centre](/Council/Contact-us/Life-Centres/Leigh.aspx "Leigh Life Centre")

 Providing face\-to\-face information, help and advice about council services.

## [Leigh Regeneration Project](/Council/Projects/Leigh-Regeneration-Project.aspx "Leigh Regeneration Project")

 We are transforming Leigh Town Centre, making it more attractive and accessible.

## [Leisure activities for young people](/Resident/Leisure/Leisure-activities-and-information-for-young-people.aspx "Leisure activities for young people")

 From libraries and museums, to sporting activities and fun things to do.

## [Leisure centres](/BeWell/Leisure-centres/Index.aspx "Leisure centres")

 Class and swim timetables, opening times, how to book and facilities in our 7 leisure centres located across Wigan borough.

## [Libraries](/Resident/Libraries/index.aspx "Libraries")

 Find a library, search the catalogue, renew your books and find out about events and activities.

## [Licensing and permits](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/index.aspx "Licensing and permits")

 Apply for licenses for entertainment, taxis, gambling, trading, keeping animals, buildings and highways.

## [Life Centres](/Council/Contact-us/Life-Centres/index.aspx "Life Centres")

 Visit our Life Centres for face\-to\-face information, help and advice about council services.

## [Lifestyle Advice and Support](/BeWell/Health-Services/Health-Advice/Lifestyle-Advice-and-Support.aspx "Lifestyle Advice and Support")

 Are you looking to improve your health and wellbeing? Maybe you would like to quit smoking, drink less, be more active or eat more healthily? Or maybe you just want to feel better about yourself but you're not sure where to start?

## [LINC 2 \- Young persons survival guide](/LINC2/index.aspx "LINC 2 - Young persons survival guide")

 For young people living in Wigan \- get information about issues that affect you and services to support you.

## [Links to other useful webpages](/Business/Professionals/Early-Help/Early-Help-policies-and-strategies/Links-to-other-useful-webpages.aspx "Links to other useful webpages")

 Links to other useful webpages

## [Litter and Fly\-tipping \- The Basics](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Rubbish-and-Litter/Keep-It-Clean/Litter-The-Basics.aspx "Litter and Fly-tipping - The Basics")

 Litter can be anything from a dropped cigarette butt\- the kind of litter that was found in the most places around our borough\- to sweet wrappers, drinks bottles and cans, to takeaway packaging thrown out of car windows.

## [Local Kitchen](/Business/Local-Kitchen/Index.aspx "Local Kitchen")

 Local Kitchen provide school meal services across Wigan borough.

## [Long term conditions scheme](/BeWell/Health-Services/Long-term-conditions-scheme.aspx "Long term conditions scheme")

 A programme of physical activity designed to help improve your health and quality of life.

## [Love Local](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Be-Kind/Support-Local/Index.aspx "Love Local")

 A new campaign encouraging people to \#SupportLocal and help independent retailers thrive.

Displaying 1 to 30 of 30

## [Haigh Woodland Park](/Resident/Leisure/Greenheart/Haigh-Hall-and-Country-Park.aspx "Haigh Woodland Park")

 A beautiful stately home set in acres of gardens with a golf course, a kitchen courtyard full of boutique food and drink stores and fun activities for the whole family.

## [Haigh Woodland Park \- Heritage, Nature and People project](/Council/Projects/Haigh-Project/Index.aspx "Haigh Woodland Park - Heritage, Nature and People project")

 A project to link our natural and built heritage to health and wellbeing through outdoor activities, audience development, volunteering and training.

## [Have your say](/LINC2/Have-a-say/Have-a-say.aspx "Have your say")

 Ways for young people in Wigan to have their say about what issues affect them.

## [Hazardous waste](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Hazardous-waste.aspx "Hazardous waste")

 Hazardous, clinical, chemical or toxic waste must not be put into your domestic bins.

## [Health and safety](/Business/Health-and-Safety/index.aspx "Health and safety")

 Information on insurance and appeals, what to do when accidents occur, and advice for various job types.

## [Health and social care](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/index.aspx "Health and social care")

 Services, support and wellbeing information for adults and children.

## [Health and Wellbeing Services](/BeWell/Health-Services/Index.aspx "Health and Wellbeing Services")

 Health and wellbeing initiatives, including our activity referral scheme, activities for people with disabilities and older people, weight management and more.

## [Health Improvement](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Health-and-wellbeing/Health-Improvement.aspx "Health Improvement")

 Health Improvement sessions for children

## [Healthwatch](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Healthwatch.aspx "Healthwatch")

 Opportunity to make your views heard about health and social care in Wigan Borough so services can be designed around the people who use them.

## [Healthy Schools](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Health-and-wellbeing/Healthy-Schools.aspx "Healthy Schools")

 A collaborative approach to whole school health and wellbeing.

## [Hearing and vision support (adults)](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Hearing-and-vision-support.aspx "Hearing and vision support (adults)")

 If you have a hearing or visual impairment we look at the best ways to help you be as independent as possible.

## [Help to Keep It Clean](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Rubbish-and-Litter/Keep-It-Clean/Help-to-Keep-It-Clean.aspx "Help to Keep It Clean")

 The Council is working to make it as easy as possible for people to dispose of their waste responsibly.

## [Help with living at home](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Getting-help/Support-after-illness-or-injury.aspx "Help with living at home")

 For 6 weeks we can offer care and support to help you keep living in your own home.

## [Here for you](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Here-for-you/Index.aspx "Here for you")

 Signposting you to services, organisations, resources and advice to help with benefits and welfare support, borrowing wisely, keeping warm, eating well and keeping well

## [High Street Heritage Action Zone \- King Street](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Policies-and-Guidance/High-Street-Heritage-Action-Zone.aspx "High Street Heritage Action Zone - King Street")

 How we're using funding to revive King Street and make it the go\-to place for cultural and leisure activities.

## [Highway maintenance](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Highway-maintenance.aspx "Highway maintenance")

 Report issues with roads and pavements in Wigan borough.

## [Highway projection licence](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Buildings-Highways/HighwayProjectionLicence.aspx "Highway projection licence")

 Apply for a licence to place private apparatus along, over or across a public highway, such as cables, balconies, canopies etc.

## [Hire an apprentice or trainee for your business](/Business/Business-Support/Apprentices/index.aspx "Hire an apprentice or trainee for your business")

 What you need to do and the funding available to help you recruit an apprentice or trainee.

## [Home boarding / Doggy day care](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Animals/Home-boarding.aspx "Home boarding / Doggy day care")

 Find out if you need a licence for home boarding/day care for dogs.

## [Home education](/Resident/Education/Alternative-education/Home-education.aspx "Home education")

 Help and support to educate your child at home.

## [Homelessness](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Homelessness/index.aspx "Homelessness")

 What to do if you're experiencing problems with homelessness, domestic abuse, relationship breakdown and more.

## [House in multiple occupation (HMO) licence](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Houses-in-Multiple-Occupation-Licence.aspx "House in multiple occupation (HMO) licence")

 How to apply for, renew or change a licence for multiple occupation of a house.

## [Household Support Fund](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Household-support-fund.aspx "Household Support Fund")

 Financial support for food, energy (heating, cooking, lighting), water bills (including sewerage) and other essential items

## [Housing](/Resident/Housing/index.aspx "Housing")

 Apply to get a council house, advice for buying or renting a home, homes for older people and more.

## [Housing Benefit \- Disputes and appeals](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Appeals.aspx "Housing Benefit - Disputes and appeals")

 Dispute or appeal a decision we have made about your Housing Benefit.

## [Housing register](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Housing-register/index.aspx "Housing register")

 How to apply to get on the register and find out how we allocate and prioritise our homes.

## [Housing repairs and improvements](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Repairs/index.aspx "Housing repairs and improvements")

 Council house repairs, bathroom refurbishments, property improvements, gas services, asbestos and smoke detectors.

## [Housing Strategy and Housing Needs Assessment](/Council/Strategies-Plans-and-Policies/Housing/HousingStrategies.aspx "Housing Strategy and Housing Needs Assessment")

 The council's housing strategy and Housing Needs Assessment for Wigan Borough.

## [How can I help tackle homelessness?](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Find-a-home/Homelessness/Help-tackle-homelessness.aspx "How can I help tackle homelessness?")

 Real Change Wigan and Leigh has been set up to support people in the local area experiencing homelessness.

## [How we work](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-health-and-care-services/How-we-work.aspx "How we work")

 There's something special about working in Wigan. Ask anyone and you'll hear the same words being used time and time again ­– friendly, empowering, supportive, positive, welcoming, challenging, fun. And these words come up so often because they really do capture what working in Wigan is like.

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Parking, roads and travel](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking-Roads-Travel.aspx "Go to Parking, roads and travel from here")/[Roads](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Roads.aspx "Go to Roads from here")/Roadworks bulletin

# Roadworks bulletin

The aim of this bulletin is to give the public advance notice of roadworks in the Wigan Council area. The council recognises that roadworks can cause inconvenience and it is hoped that this information helps to minimise delays and other problems associated with the works.

This bulletin is updated weekly and every effort has been made to provide accurate and up\-to\-date information, but it is not intended to be a definitive list and cannot cater for works carried out at short notice. The council also reserves the right to make changes to the programme if emergencies arise.

For any emergency work that has a major impact on the road network, we aim to notify members of the public via Wigan Council's social media pages as soon as possible.

## Emergency Works

* **Mosley Common Road, Worsley**\- There are currently emergency works being undertaken by Electricity North West with temporary 2\-Way Signals in place. Works are expected to be completed by 2nd September
* **Hough Lane, Tyldesley** \- There are currently emergency works being undertaken by Cadent Gas with temporary multi\-way signals in place. Works are expected to be completed by 2nd September.

## Major Schemes

* **Ince Green Lane, Ince in Makerfield** \- Network Rail will be undertaking works to electrify the railway which includes the demolition and rebuilding of the existing railway bridge. The works will include the use of a road closure and will commence on 22nd April for a period of 31 weeks. We are encouraging all residents, businesses, and organisations to sign up to get the most up to date information about the works. If you are interested in receiving future updates via email, you can [sign up online (external link)](https://lineside.networkrail.co.uk/boltonToWiganElectrificationSignUp). For any additional questions or concerns, you can visit [living by the railway (external link)](https://www.networkrail.co.uk/communities/living-by-the-railway/) or telephone the 24\-Hour National Helpline on 03457 11 41 41
* **Whelley, Wigan** \- Cadent Gas will be undertaking gas mains reinforcement works which will replace the existing gas mains with new PE Plastic gas mains. These are essential works due to a number of gas leaks in this location and will include replacing around 100 metres of gas mains pipework. The works will include the use of temporary two\-way traffic signals, and will commence on 19th October and are due to be completed by 27th October. For any enquiries regarding these works, the utility can be contacted via telephone on 0800 389 8000 / 0161 351 5370 or [mainsreplacement@cadentgas.com](mailto:mainsreplacement@cadentgas.com).

## Road Closures

* **East Lancashire Road, Golborne** will be closed Westbound from Golborne Island on 19th September for a period of 3 Nights between the hours of 20:00 and 06:00 only
* **Wallgate, Wigan** will be closed at the Railway Bridge on 30th September to 04th October 2024 between the hours of 22:00 and 05:00
* **Bryn Road South, Ashton in Makerfield** will be closed outside House Number 45 on 03rd October 2024 between the hours of 12:00 and 15:00\.
* **Warrington Road, Wigan** will be closed at the Railway Bridge on 5th October for 1 Night between the hours of 22:00and 06:00
* **Lowton Road, Golborne** will be closed outside House Number 57 on 24th October between the hours of 09:30 and 14:30
* **Winstanley Road, Ashton in Makerfield** will be closed on 15th November between the hours of 09:30 and 15:30\.

## Resurfacing Schemes

* **A579 Bolton Road, Atherton** will be closed from its junction with Mealhouse Lane to Outside House Number 38 on consecutive Sundays on 18th August, 1st September and 08th September between the hours of 07:00 and 19:00
* **Wigan Road, Leigh** will be closed from Outside House Number 236 to outside House Number 296 on consecutive Sundays on 1st September and 8th September between the hours of 08:00 and 16:00
* **Atherleigh Way, Atherton** from its junction with Lovers Lane to Lighting Column No.160 on 2ndSeptember to 6th September between the hours of 20:00 and 05:00 only
* **Ormskirk Road, Wigan** will be closed from its junction with Richmond Hill to its junction with Smethurst Road on consecutive Sundays on 8th September and 15th September between the hours of 08:00 and 17:00
* **B5238 Whelley, Wigan** will be closed from its junction with Great Acre to its junction with Plantation Gates on Consecutive Sundays 15th September, 22nd September, 29th September and 6th October 2024, between the hours of 08:00 and 19:00
* **Ormskirk Road, Wigan** will be closed from outside House Number 526 to its junction with Ellesmere Road on consecutive Sundays on 22ndSeptember and 29th September between the hours of 08:00 and 17:00
* **Stadium Way, Wigan** will be closed from its junction with Scot Lane to the Adoption Limit on 7th October to 9th October between the hours of 22:00 and 05:00 only.
* **Wigan Lane, Wigan** will be closed from its junction with Springfield Street to its junction with Penson Street on consecutive Sundays on 13th October and 20th October between the hours of 08:00 and 17:00
* **Bridge Street, Hindley** will be closed from its junction with Market Street to its junction with Castle Hill Road on consecutive Sundays on 27th October and 3rd November between the hours of 08:00 and 17:00
* **Almond Brook Road, Standish** will be closed from its junction with Beacon View to outside House Number 164 on consecutive Sundays on 17th November and 24th November between the hours of 08:00 and 17:00

## Events

* **Wigan 10K** \- A number of roads will be closed in Wigan on Sunday 1st September from 08:00 to 14:00 in support of Wigan 10K. Details of the route can be found on [Wigan 10K (external link)](https://wigan10k.co.uk/) website
* **Standish Christmas Market** \- Cross Street and Market Place will be closed for Standish Christmas Market on Saturday 30th November to 1st December between the hours of 00:01 to 00:00
* **Pemberton Christmas Market** \- Chapel Street will be closed for Pemberton Christmas Market on Sunday 1st December between the hours of 06:00 to 18:00\.

## Useful resources

Take a look at the useful resources below to help you forward plan your journeys in and out of Wigan borough.

* [View the list of all roadworks in Wigan and the surrounding area](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roadworks-bulletin.pdf "Roadworks_bulletin")
* [View a list of roadworks on motorways in the region](https://nationalhighways.co.uk/travel-updates/road-closure-report/).

## Telephone numbers for roadworks queries

* BT \- 0800 023 2023
* Cadent Gas (formerly National Grid Gas) (Escapes) \- 0800 389 8000
* Electricity North West \- 105
* Greater Manchester Police \- 0161 872 5050
* [Highways England (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/highways-england) \- Motorway Network \- 0300 123 5000
* Network Rail 24\-Hour National Helpline \- 03457 11 41 41
* United Utilities Water (including drainage) \- 0345 672 3723
* Virgin Media \- 0845 454 1111
* Wigan Council (emergencies \- out of hours) \- 01942 404040\.

# Affordable Home Ownership Hub

# Marriages and other ceremonies

![Marriages and other ceremonies banner](/Images/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Marriages-and-ceremonies/Marriages-and-other-ceremonies-banner.jpg)

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Bins and recycling](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Go to Bins and recycling from here")/Which bin do I use?

# Which bin do I use?

[![Do not recycle nappies](/Images/Resident/Bins-and-Recycling/Nappies-norecycle-Cropped-672x140.jpg)](https://directory.wigan.gov.uk/kb5/wigan/fsd/advice.page?id=VQ6Id3E0EOI)
Please help us to recycle as much as possible into the right bins \- contaminated bins cost money.

See our [tips for safe storage of waste before collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Putting-your-bin-out-for-collection.aspx "Putting your bin out for collection") and help protect our collection crew.

## Battery Recycling

Batteries are often found in products like laptops, tablets, mobile phones, radio\-controlled toys, Bluetooth devices, shavers, electric toothbrushes, power tools, scooters, kid’s plastic toys, remotes controls, and even e\-cigarettes etc.

* The research suggests that at least 25% of the UK population appear to be binning batteries, and nearly a third (29%) of those people who dispose of electrical items have put at least one of them in a household bin or the wrong recycling container in the past year
* Many people are unaware that there are embedded batteries in some electrical waste and the electrical items most commonly disposed of within the last year are electric toothbrushes (39% of respondents), device charger/powerbank (24%) and shavers/trimmers (22%). Other items commonly disposed of included electric toys, power tools, e\-cigarettes and Bluetooth earbuds
* Of the people who throw batteries in the bin, most say they don’t know what to do with them, and only 10% of those that bin batteries are aware of the fire risk. Those binning batteries appear more likely to be younger and female, particularly for loose batteries
* People who are aware, or who are made aware, of the fire risk are less likely to bin batteries.

Batteries **SHOULD NOT** be disposed of in any of the kerbside bins. Find your nearest battery recycling outlet from the [Recycle Now Locator (external link)](https://www.recyclenow.com/recycling-locator).

Blue bin / white sack
| ALLOWED | NOT ALLOWED |
| --- | --- |
| Office paper | Nappies / Incontinence pads |
| Junk mail | Food |
| Catalogues, brochures and directories | Plastic bags |
| Newspapers and magazines | Plastic wrappers |
| Envelopes | Plastic trays |
| Greeting cards (without glitter) | Polystyrene |
| Cardboard (including printed or plain) | Hard back and paper back books |
| Kitchen and toilet roll inner tubes | Crisp packets |
|  | Wallpaper |
|  | Empty Food and drink cartons \- inc Tetra pak |

Brown bin
| ALLOWED | NOT ALLOWED |
| --- | --- |
| Cans, tins and aerosols | Plastic bags, plastic wrapping, plastic film |
| Glass bottles | Coat hangers |
| Glass jars | Plant pots |
| Plastic bottles | Furniture or toys |
| Yoghurt pots | Food |
| Household plastic pots and tubs | Nappies / Incontinence pads |
| Aluminium foil | Foil type food sachets, coffee pods |
|  | Electrical items |
|  | Hosepipes, wire |
|  | Wine and beverage glasses |
|  | Window pane glass |

Green bin / green caddy
| ALLOWED | NOT ALLOWED |
| --- | --- |
| Grass | Cardboard |
| Leaves | Large branches (more than 15cm diameter) |
| Twigs | Soil |
| Small branches (less than 15cm diameter) | Rubble |
| Food including: Bread and pastries / egg shells and dairy (no liquids) / fish (raw or cooked) / fruit and vegetables / meat and bones (raw or cooked) / teabags and coffee grounds / leftover food. | Food packaging |
|  | Liquid oils and fat |
|  | Liquid dairy products such as milk, yoghurt or cream |
|  | Plastic bags |

You can put food waste straight into your green bin (no food waste bag needed).

* [Where to get replacement caddy liners](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Food-caddies.aspx "Replacement caddy liners").

Please ensure you recycle as much as possible using your Blue, Brown and Green bins.

Black bin
| ALLOWED | NOT ALLOWED |
| --- | --- |
| Anything that is not allowed in the above bins | Soil |
| Nappies / Incontinence pads | Rubble |
| Dog foul | Building materials |
| Cat litter | Liquid waste (including paints and oils) |
|  | Hazardous waste |
|  | Prohibited items |

For advice on how to dispose of these items, visit:

* [Hazardous waste](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Hazardous-waste.aspx "Hazardous waste")
* [Prohibited items](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Prohibited-items.aspx "Prohibited waste")

**Please make sure that your bin is placed at the collection point no later than 6\.30am on your collection day.**

## Food waste collections

Every household has a small, silver kitchen caddy and a supply of compostable liners to make recycling food waste clean and easy. Watch the video below to find out how you can help be part of the council's drive to reduce waste, recycle more and save money.

## Waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE) recycling

Residents can now recycle their waste electrical items (old kettles, hair\-straighteners, toasters, etc.) at the locations listed below:

* [Chanters Household Waste Recycling Centre](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres"), Arley Way, Atherton, M46 9FF
* [Kirkless Household Waste Recycling Centre](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres"), Makerfield Way, Higher Ince, WN2 2PR
* [Slag Lane Household Waste Recycling Centre](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres"), Slag Lane, Lowton, WA3 1BZ
* [The Brick Works (external link)](https://www.thebrick.org.uk/our-work/brick-re-use/), 4 Hodson Street, Wigan, WN3 4EN

If the item is still in working order then you can [donate them to your nearest charity shop](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bulky-collections.aspx "Bulky Collections").

Please do not put any electrical items into your brown bin, as we cannot recycle these with your brown waste items.

# Adult Learning and Skills

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Parking, roads and travel](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking-Roads-Travel.aspx "Go to Parking, roads and travel from here")/[Parking](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-and-Permits.aspx "Go to Parking from here")/[Parking permits](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-permits/Parking-permits.aspx "Go to Parking permits from here")/Parking permit

# Parking permit

Important notices
Annual visitor and daily scratch card permits can only be used by people visiting the premises of the permit holder. Misuse of permits will result in the permit being withdrawn.

From 6th May 2024, we will be increasing the parking permit charges. [View the new charges](#permitprices).

## Residents

**Renewing a permit that has not yet expired**

You cannot purchase a new annual visitor permit if your current visitor permit has NOT yet expired. You must renew instead.

When renewing a permit that has not yet expired, you need to input the permit number of your current permit and select 'Send e\-mail PIN reminder'. Please ensure it is input exactly as displayed on your permit. A unique PIN will be sent to the email address used to purchase your current permit. Enter this PIN in the relevant box and select 'Renew permit', before making a payment.

You are entitled to one resident permit per vehicle if your usual place of residence is within a Controlled Parking Zone (CPZ).

* [Find out which Controlled Parking Zone you live in](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-permits/Controlled-Parking-Zone-locations.aspx "Controlled parking zone locations")
* [What is a Controlled Parking Zone and what are the regulations?](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-permits/Parking-regulations.aspx "Parking regulations")
* [What if my neighbourhood is not in a Controlled Parking Zone?](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-permits/Do-not-live-in-a-Controlled-Parking-Zone.aspx "What if my area is not a Controlled Parking Zone?")

You can apply for a resident permit, an annual visitor permit or a daily visitor permit. Your permit should take approximately five working days to arrive.

### Do I apply or do I renew?

You will need to **apply for a new permit** if:

* Your current permit has **already expired**
* You’re a new resident or have a new vehicle so require an annual resident or annual visitor permit for the first time.

You will need to **renew your permit** if:

* You’re renewing a current permit that has **NOT yet expired**.

### How to apply / renew a parking permit

* [Apply for or renew a resident parking permit](https://parkingpermits.wigan.gov.uk/EasiPermits/index.aspx "Apply for or renew a parking permit")

Each household is allowed one annual visitor permit per year. You cannot use a visitor permit in your own vehicle, it can only be used by people visiting premises.

If you own a property but do not reside there, you are entitled to the daily visitor permit only.

### What proof do I need to provide?

When applying for your resident permit, you will need to provide:

* Full Vehicle Registration Document (V5\) or Car Insurance Document that quotes your address. Please note either of these documents will need to be uploaded at the time of application. Only vehicles registered to that property will be entitled to apply for the residents permit.

## Businesses

Businesses are entitled to permits if the business is operating from an address within the controlled parking zone and the vehicle for which the permit is required is necessary for the operation of the business. You can apply for a business permit or a daily business permit.

* [Apply for or renew a business parking permit](https://parkingpermits.wigan.gov.uk/EasiPermits/index.aspx "Business parking permit application")

## Parking Permit charges

From 6th May 2024, the charges will be:

* Resident Permit \- £25\.00
* Resident Visitor day permit pack \- £10\.00
* Resident Visitor permit \- £25\.00
* Business (1st permit) \- £25\.00
* Business (2nd permit) \- £75\.00
* Business (3rd and subsequent) \- £200\.00
* Business half day visitor permits \- £42\.00

## Contract parking (town centre car parks)

Anyone can purchase a contract parking permit for a town centre car park. The permits can last for three months, six months or one year.

**Please note: The Railway Arches car park in Leigh is now permanently closed.**

**The permit application system is currently being updated to allow customers the option to apply for a Spinning Gate car park contract permit. Before these changes take effect, if you would like to apply for a Spinning Gate contract parking permit, please use the Railway Arches permit type. They will be valid for use on the Spinning Gate car park**.

* [Apply for or renew a contract car park permit](https://parkingpermits.wigan.gov.uk/EasiPermits/index.aspx "Contract parking permit application")
* [Contract parking terms and conditions](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Contract-parking-terms-and-conditions.pdf "ContractParkingTermsConditions")

## Discounts on your permit

You are entitled to a 50% discount on a resident permit issued for your vehicle only, as well as on an annual and daily visitor permit, if you are a:

* Senior citizen aged 60 or above at the time of application
* Blue Badge holder
* Registered charity
* Place of worship.

## Disclaimer

Wigan Council is under a duty to protect the public funds it administers, and to this end may use the information you have provided on your parking permit application form for the prevention and detection of fraud. We may also share this information with other bodies responsible for auditing or administering public funds for these purposes.

[Find further information in relation to this exercise](/Council/DataProtection-FOI-Stats/National-Fraud-Initiative.aspx "Data sharing and matching")or contact Internal Audit by emailing [auditenquiry@wigan.gov.uk](mailto:auditenquiry@wigan.gov.uk)

## Top tasks

### Apply for It

1. [Apply for or renew a parking permit](https://parkingpermits.wigan.gov.uk/EasiPermits/index.aspx "Go to the Apply for or renew a parking permit page")

* [Email](/Contacts/Parking-permit.aspx#ContactEmail)
* [Telephone Number](/Contacts/Parking-permit.aspx#ContactTelephone)

page_content='Flooding advice

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

[Skip to content](#L3_MainContentPlaceholder)

  [Login](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk) 

[Wigan Council](/index.aspx)

* [Resident](/index.aspx)
* [Business](/Business/index.aspx "index")
* [Council](/Council/index.aspx "index")
* [MyAccount](/MyAccount/My-Account.aspx)
* [Visit Us](https://www.visitwigan.com/index.aspx "Visit Wigan")

[Emergency contact](https://www.wigan.gov.uk/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Emergencies.aspx "Emergency contact")

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Crime and emergencies](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Crime-and-emergencies.aspx "Go to Crime and emergencies from here")/[Flooding and draining](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Flooding/Index.aspx "Go to Flooding and draining from here")/Flooding advice

# Flooding advice

Floods can damage your property and flood water may contain sewerage and other contaminants that are a risk to your health. By planning ahead and taking precautions you can help reduce the impact of flooding on your household.

## How to prepare

We've put together the following guidance for residents, covering what to do before, during and after a flood:

* **Before** \- [How to prepare for a flood](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Floods/Preparing-for-a-flood.pdf "How to prepare for a flood")
* **During** \- [What to do when a flood warning is issued](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Floods/Flood-warning-Act-Now.pdf "Flood warning issued - Act Now")
* **During** \- [How to stay safe in a flood](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Floods/How-to-stay-safe-in-a-flood.pdf "How to stay safe in a flood")
* **After** \- [What to do after a flood](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Floods/What-to-do-following-a-flood.pdf "What to do following a flood")

For further practical advice to keep you safe and help you prepare for a flood, visit [The Flood Hub \- what to do before, during and after a flood (external link)](https://thefloodhub.co.uk/household/ "Preparing for a flood").

For communities seeking advice on the flood risk to their property and how they can make it more flood\-resistant, contact The Flood Advisory Service on 0800 970 3950, available Monday\-Friday.

## Keep up\-to\-date

There are a number of resources available to keep you up\-to\-date on the current flood situation and help you measure the flood risk to your property.

* [Find out if you’re at risk of flooding (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/check-flooding "Check flood risk")
* [Flood warning information service (external link)](https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/ "Flood warning information service")
* [Sign up for flood warnings in your area (external link)](https://www.gov.uk/sign-up-for-flood-warnings "Sign up for flood warnings")
* [See the targeted flood warning service for additional information (external link)](https://www.fws.environment-agency.gov.uk/app/olr/fwslogin)
* [Get flood alerts on your Facebook wall (external link)](https://www.facebook.com/FloodAlerts/ "Facebook flood alerts").

## Protecting your property

Property owners are responsible for protecting their own properties in the event of a flood, if you are a tenant it will be your landlord who has this responsibility. 

* [The Flood Advisory Service (external link)](https://floodadvisoryservice.co.uk/ "FAS A5 step by step guide")

## Flood\-damaged properties

* For residents that have been evacuated, only return to your property if there is no police presence and the cordon has been removed.
* Homeowners \- contact your building and contents insurance company. Take photos or bring in the insurance assessor before tidying up/repairing any damage
* Council tenants \- [report repairs online](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Repairs/index.aspx "Housing repairs and improvements") and contact your contents insurance company
* Private rent tenants \- check your tenancy agreement and contact your contents insurance company.

## After a flood

* [How to clean your home safely](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Floods/Flooding-how-to-clean-up-your-house-safely.pdf "Floods – how to clean up your home safely") – health advice and precautions to keep you safe after a flood
* Sandbags – do not remove them as they may be contaminated, we will remove them at a later date
* [Water supply advice (external link)](https://www.unitedutilities.com/emergencies/got-a-problem/flooding/ "United Utilities flooding advice") – it may be contaminated, make sure to wear gloves and wash your hands
* [Electricity supply advice (external link)](https://www.enwl.co.uk/advice-and-support/flooding-advice/ "Electricity flooding advice") – if water has reached your sockets you will need to have them checked by a qualified electrician before use
* Gas Safe Register – you’ll want to contact your gas supplier so they can advise you on the general situation in the area
* Damaged trees \- [report trees obstructing roads or pavements](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Obstructions-on-roads-and-pavements.aspx "Obstructions on roads and pavements")
* Drains and sewer flooding – if the flood is due to a burst pipe or overflowing drain, [report a burst water main](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Report-a-burst-water-main.aspx "Report a burst water main")
* Furniture \- you can take damaged furniture to any of our waste recycling centres across the Borough. [Check if you need a waste permit](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres")
* Food \- you can place your food waste in your black bin or take it to any of our [waste and recycling centres across the borough](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Waste-and-Recycling-Centres.aspx "Waste and recycling centres").

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Report flooding on the road](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Roads/Report-flooding-on-the-road.aspx "Go to the Report flooding on the road page")

 ## In this section

* [Unblocktober](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Flooding/Unblocktober.aspx "Go to Unblocktober from here")

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Business](/Business/index.aspx "Go to Business from here")/[Environmental health](/Business/Environmental-Health/index.aspx "Go to Environmental health from here")/[Food hygiene and safety](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/index.aspx "Go to Food hygiene and safety from here")/Food hygiene rating scheme

# Food hygiene rating scheme

![Food Hygiene Rating Scheme logo](/Images/Business/Food-Hygiene/FHRS-logo1.jpg)Wigan Council participate in the Food Standards Agency's national food hygiene rating scheme (FHRS), helping consumers choose where to eat out or shop for food. An up\-to\-date list of ratings for businesses in Wigan borough can be viewed on the [FSA website (external link)](https://ratings.food.gov.uk/ "Food hygiene ratings - FSA (external link)"). Food businesses inspected by food officers are given [different ratings (external link)](https://www.food.gov.uk/safety-hygiene/food-hygiene-rating-scheme) based on their compliance with the legal requirements for hygiene, structural condition and management performance.

Following a food hygiene inspection a business included in the scheme is rated a five for a very good premises through to zero for those premises that need to improve urgently, giving the consumer an indication of its overall level of food hygiene compliance.

* 5 \- very good
* 4 \- good
* 3 \- generally satisfactory
* 2 \- improvement necessary
* 1 \- major improvement necessary
* 0 \- urgent improvement necessary

Please note the rating does not reflect the quality of food, taste or standard of service and it's currently voluntary for businesses to display the rating.

As a consumer, it’s not easy to judge hygiene standards on appearance alone so the rating gives you an idea of what’s going on in the kitchen or behind closed doors. You can check the ratings and use it to choose a food business. It’s also good to share this information with friends and family.

The rating is only a reflection of conditions found on the day of the inspection and standards may have gone up or down since that inspection.

## Published ratings

After an inspection, the rating will be uploaded by the Council so that it is published on the [FSA website (external link)](https://ratings.food.gov.uk/ "Food hygiene ratings - FSA (external link)").

* Ratings of '5 \- very good' will be published as soon as the information is uploaded by the Council
* Ratings of '0 \- 4' will be published approximately 5 weeks after the date of inspection to allow for an appeal to be submitted.

### Request an early publication of ratings

The business owner or manager can [request that a rating is published before the end of the appeal period](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Consent-form.aspx "Consent for early publication of ratings").

The Council will review the request and will usually publish the rating early.

## What if a business disputes the score?

### Apply for a re\-rating

If a food business has made improvements to hygiene standards that the food officer discussed at their planned inspection they can ask for a re\-visit before the next planned inspection. The hygiene standards in their premises will be reassessed with a view to give an improved rating. This request needs to be submitted online. There is a fee payable at the time of submitting your request.

* [Submit a request to apply for a re\-rating](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Revisit-form.aspx "Food Hygiene Rating Scheme: Request for a re-visit")

### Right to reply

The business owner or manager also has a 'right to reply'. This is different from an appeal. The owner or manager can submit an explanation on how the business has improved hygiene or to say if there were unusual circumstances at the time of the inspection. A business's right to reply will be published online by the Council alongside the business's hygiene rating.

* [Submit a right to reply](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Reply-form.aspx "Food Hygiene Rating Scheme: Right to reply")

### Appeal

There is an appeals process if a business wants to dispute the FHRS given by an inspecting officer.

The business owner or manager can contact the Council's food officer that  carried out the inspection about out the rating received. If the business owner or manager still thinks the rating is unfair or wrong, they can appeal online.

* [Submit an appeal](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Appeal-form.aspx "Food Hygiene Rating Scheme: Appeal form")

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Find a food hygiene rating](https://ratings.food.gov.uk/ "Go to the Find a food hygiene rating page")
### Apply for It

1. [Apply for a re\-rating](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Revisit-form.aspx "Go to the Apply for a re-rating page")
2. [Right to reply](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Reply-form.aspx "Go to the Right to reply page")
3. [Appeal form](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Appeal-form.aspx "Go to the Appeal form page")
4. [Request an early publication of ratings](/Business/Environmental-Health/Food-Hygiene-and-Safety/FHRS-Consent-form.aspx "Go to the Request an early publication of ratings page")

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Bins and recycling](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Bins-and-Recycling.aspx "Go to Bins and recycling from here")/Putting your bin out for collection

# Putting your bin out for collection

* See [which bin do I use?](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Which-bin-do-I-use.aspx "Which bin do I use?") if you're not sure what colour bin your waste should go in.

## When you put your bins out on your collection day:

* Put all waste inside the bin with the lid closed flat
* **Don't** overload the bin, make it too heavy, leave extra bags out or fill with incorrect materials
* Put your bins out at the edge of your property boundary by 6\.30am on collection day, but no earlier than 6pm the evening before (unless you are in receipt of an [assisted collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Assisted-bin-collections.aspx "Assisted bin collections"))
* Place your bin with handles facing the road in a position that isn't causing an obstruction
* Make sure your bin is numbered
* Take your bin back within the boundary of your property after collection.

## Bins left on the pavement

All bins should be back within the boundary of the property (or alley\-gated area) by midnight on the day of collection or you could face further action.

## I need help putting my bin out

If you are unable to put your bin out yourself, and you have no neighbours or friends who can help you, you may be able to have an  [assisted collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Assisted-bin-collections.aspx "Assisted bin collections").

## Report a missed bin

Where weather conditions or vehicle access is an issue we will return to affected properties on the first available collection date.

If your bin has not been collected and you have followed the guidance above then you can [report a missed bin](https://wasteforms.wigan.gov.uk/MissedBins/Default.aspx "Report missed bin").

## Cleaning your bin

It is your responsibility to keep your bins clean. See our simple steps to [keeping your bin clean](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Keeping-your-bins-clean.aspx "Keeping your bins clean").

## Top tasks

# Bins and recycling

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/[Resident](/Resident/index.aspx "Go to Resident from here")/[Council Tax](/Resident/Council-Tax/Council-Tax.aspx "Go to Council Tax from here")/Pay your Council Tax

# Pay your Council Tax

## Pay online

You can pay your Council Tax bill online with a debit or credit card, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

* [Pay your Council Tax bill online](https://ip.e-paycapita.com/AIP/itemSelectionPage.do?link=showItemSelectionPage&siteId=277&languageCode=EN&source=AIP&fc=04 "Pay your Council Tax") \- your reference should start with a 4\.
* [Pay your Council Tax arrears online](https://ip.e-paycapita.com/AIP/itemSelectionPage.do?link=showItemSelectionPage&siteId=277&languageCode=EN&so%20urce=AIP&fc=03 "Pay your Council Tax arrears") \- following a Liability Order Information Request or Notice of Enforcement. Your reference should start with a 3\.

## Pay by Direct Debit

Direct Debit is the easiest way to pay your bill. We offer customers a choice of five dates each month when they can pay. These are the 1st, 6th, 15th, 21st and 27th. You can also ask to pay over 12 months instead of 10, or however many months remain in the year.

You are also protected by the Direct Debit Guarantee, which promises that you will get your money back straight away if anything goes wrong.

* [Set up a Direct Debit to pay your Council Tax](https://finforms.wigan.gov.uk/Viewer-VicForms.asp?user=anon&Form=Wigan%20Standalone%20Council%20Tax%20Direct%20Debit%20(1.1).wdf "Direct Debit Council Tax form").

## Pay on the telephone

You can pay your bill by credit or debit card **24 hours a day** by phoning the automated bill payment hotline **01942 489006**. Have your card and Council Tax account reference number ready when you call. Payments cannot be made with American Express cards.

## Pay via telephone / online banking, or by standing order

To pay your bill via telephone or online banking, or by standing order with your bank you will need our bank details:

* Our bank account number is: 63553698
* Our sort code is: 20\-55\-58
* If you are paying your Council Tax Bill, you must quote your 12 digit Council Tax account reference starting with a 4\. This is shown on the front of your bill as the reference for your payment.
* If you are paying your outstanding Council Tax arrears following a Liability Order Information Request or Notice of Enforcement, you must quote your 9 digit reference starting with a 3\. This will be shown on the top right of the letter you have received.

## Pay at Post Office or PayPoint

You can pay your bill or outstanding balance by cash, debit card or credit card at any Post Office or by cash at any PayPoint outlet nationwide. You will need a bill with a barcode on it to pay. If you already have one of these simply take it along and make the payment.

## Corporate debt policy

The council has a [corporate debt policy](/Docs/PDF/Council/Performance-and-Spending/CorporateDebtPolicy.pdf "Corporate Debt Policy") governing the treatment of debt which provides information and advice to customers who may be experiencing problems.

## Top tasks

### Top Task

1. [Set up a direct debit to pay your Council Tax](https://finforms.wigan.gov.uk/Viewer-VicForms.asp?user=anon&Form=Wigan%20Standalone%20Council%20Tax%20Direct%20Debit%20(1.1).wdf "Go to the Set up a direct debit to pay your Council Tax page")
### Pay for it

1. [Pay your Council Tax](https://ip.e-paycapita.com/AIP/itemSelectionPage.do?link=showItemSelectionPage&siteId=277&languageCode=EN&source=AIP&fc=04 "Go to the Pay your Council Tax page")

## Contact us

* [Telephone Number](/Contacts/Council-Tax-pay-by-phone.aspx#ContactTelephone)
