## [Targeted Education Support Service (TESS)](/Resident/Education/Educational-support/TESS.aspx "Targeted Education Support Service (TESS)")

 Providing support where learning and/or behaviour of a child are a concern and may have an effect on their achievement.

## [Targeted youth services](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Targeted-Services.aspx "Targeted youth services")

 We work with children and young people aged 8\-18 (and up to 25 if you have a disability) if they're experiencing difficulties..

## [Tattoo advice](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/fit-and-well/tattoo-advice.aspx "Tattoo advice")

 Tips on what to think about before getting a tattoo and find registered tattoo premises in the borough.

## [Taxis and private hire](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Taxi-and-Private-Hire/index.aspx "Taxis and private hire")

 Licensing and permits for taxis and private hire vehicles.

## [Teachers](/Business/Professionals/Newly-Qualified-Teachers/Newly-qualified-teachers.aspx "Teachers")

 Information and advice to help new teachers complete the Newly Qualified Teacher (NQT) induction year.

## [Team Wigan Social Care Careers](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Social-care-careers/Team-Wigan-Social-Care-Careers.aspx "Team Wigan Social Care Careers")

 Social care careers

## [TechMates](/Council/Digital-Wigan/Get-online.aspx "TechMates")

 Help to get online through our TechMates service, guidance on helping others, library support and more.

## [Tell us if you're planning an event](/Resident/Leisure/Event-notification.aspx "Tell us if you're planning an event")

 Tell us about an event you are organising in the borough.

## [Tell Us Once](/Resident/Births-Marriage-Deaths/Deaths/Tell-Us-Once.aspx "Tell Us Once")

 When someone has died, we can help you tell the services at the council who need to know.

## [Temporary event notice](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Entertainment-Alcohol-Late-Night-Refreshments/Temporary-event-notice.aspx "Temporary event notice")

 If you want to hold an ad\-hoc event you must give us a Temporary Event Notice (TEN) at least 10 working days before the event.

## [Tenant references](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/Your-tenancy/Rents-and-benefits/Tenant-references.aspx "Tenant references")

 Providing council tenants with a reference if they are moving home.

## [Tenants \- council properties](/Resident/Housing/Council-homes/index.aspx "Tenants - council properties")

 Tenancy information and advice on finding a home, applying for the housing register, reporting repairs and more.

## [Tennis at Robin Park](/BeWell/Activities-sports/Tennis/Index.aspx "Tennis at Robin Park")

 Robin Park Tennis Centre offers coaching, competition, team tennis, beginner and advanced classes, social evenings and fitness classes.

## [Terrorism](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Counter-terrorism/Index.aspx "Terrorism")

 What to do in a terrorist attack, identifying suspicious behaviour / package and how to help prevent terrorism

## [The Deal for Children and Young People](/Council/The-Deal/The-Deal-for-Children-and-Young-People.aspx "The Deal for Children and Young People")

 Wigan Council have put together a draft Deal for Children and Young People.

## [Things to do](/LINC2/Things-to-do/Things-to-do.aspx "Things to do")

 Activities and things to do for young people across Wigan borough.

## [Town centre plans](/Business/Business-Support/Choose-Wigan/Town-Centre-Plans.aspx "Town centre plans")

 See our plans for regenerating Wigan, Leigh and Ashton town centres.

## [Town centres](/Business/Business-Support/Town-centre-management.aspx "Town centres")

 Regeneration and economic development initiatives and support for the local business in tackling issues in town centres.

## [Town Twinning \- Wigan and Angers](/Council/Town-Twinning/Index.aspx "Town Twinning - Wigan and Angers")

 Learn about what the Wigan and Angers twinning does and how you can get involved.

## [Trade waste](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Trade-waste.aspx "Trade waste")

 Disposing of waste from shops, factories, offices or any other trade or business.

## [Trading Standards \- business](/Business/Trading-Standards/index.aspx "Trading Standards - business")

 The Good Trader scheme, consumer advice, underage sales, counterfeit goods and more.

## [Training and learning](/Resident/Jobs-Careers/Adult-community-learning.aspx "Training and learning")

 Flexible learning, courses and training for all ages to help you build your skills.

## [Travel](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Travel/Travel.aspx "Travel")

 Walking, cycling and journey planning around Wigan Borough.

## [Travel and access to facilities](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Community-support/Travel-and-access.aspx "Travel and access to facilities")

 Bus/travel passes, services and access to facilities to help older people and those with disabilities to get out and about.

## [Travellers](/Resident/Housing/Travellers/Gypsy-and-Traveller-Sites.aspx "Travellers")

 How to report an unauthorised encampment and what the council can do.

## [Trees, conservation and heritage](/Business/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Conservation-trees-and-hedges/index.aspx "Trees, conservation and heritage")

 Information about conservation areas, listed buildings, trees and woodlands and how to deal with high hedges.

## [Trencherfield Mill Steam Engine](/Resident/Museums-archives/Trencherfield-Mill-Engine.aspx "Trencherfield Mill Steam Engine")

 This steam engine is one of the largest and finest working examples of its type, visit us on Steam Sundays to see it in action.

## [Types of fostering](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Fostering/Types-of-fostering/Types-of-fostering.aspx "Types of fostering")

 Fostering options including short break care, remand, respite, step up and step down.

# Welfare advice and support

[![Here for you banner](/Images/Council/The-Deal/Here-for-you/Here-for-you-banner.png)](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Here-for-you/Index.aspx "Here for you")

* [Universal CreditBringing together a range of working age benefits into a single payment](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Universal-Credit.aspx)
* [Benefit capThe Government has put a limit on the total amount of benefit that working age people can receive](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Benefit-cap.aspx)
* [Personal Independence PaymentsPIP is an assessment of individual needs and helps with some of the extra costs caused by ill\-health or disability](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Personal-Independence-Payments.aspx)
* [Local welfare supportProviding support to people in crisis with advice and signpost you to a service that can help](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Local-Welfare-Support.aspx)
* [Household Support FundGet support with the cost of food, energy and other essential items](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Household-support-fund.aspx)
* [Harmful gamblingIf you or someone you know has a problem with gambling, support and advice is available](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Gambling-counselling.aspx)

# Privacy policy

This website is owned and controlled by Wigan Council. We regard your privacy as important and any personal information you give to us will only be used in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation 2018\. We do not store personal information about people who visit this site unless they provide contact information or use one of our online services.

If you provide any personal information in order to use a service on this website, it will only be used for the reasons given in our privacy notice. It will not be shared with any third party without your consent, unless required by law or in order to comply with duties to prevent and detect crime or to protect public funds.

## Legal basis

Any personal information you give us, whether sent to us via online forms, the app or through other means, is held securely and will only be used for council purposes relating to our public tasks and functions or with your consent (where you have agreed to us communicating with you about different offers and services).

## Cookies

We use cookies so that you do not need to enter information again if you return to some pages. We do not use information gathered by cookies for any other reason.

## Web Chat

Web Chat is available for a number of services on the Wigan Council website.

It allows you to speak to council officers using 'web chat' functionality. Data from each 'chat' will be held for 12 months and may be used when looking into your enquiry and for quality purposes.

You may be asked to complete a short survey on completion of your web chat. All answers for the survey are anonymised and will be used for service improvement.

## MyAccount

MyAccount is provided by a third party supplier. This supplier is under contract and has to keep your details safe and secure, and use them only to provide and maintain the service. MyAccount is your online customer account and, if you register, your details will be processed for the following purposes.

### Purposes of processing your data

In general, we will hold your personal data for the purpose of maintaining and operating your account or registration and will use your personal information:

* For the purpose you provided the information for and to carry out our statutory duties
* To verify your entitlement to access the services you have requested e.g verification of your residence in the borough
* To communicate with you and provide information about services appropriate to your needs
* For planning purposes to improve how we deliver our services to you in the future.

### Sharing

We may pass your personal data onto the people who provide the service you have requested and to other council services to ensure your data is accurate and kept up to date. We will never sell your information or share it with other organisations for marketing, market research or commercial purposes.

### Retention

We will hold the personal data used to create your account until you delete your account. However, the personal data associated with the services you receive may be retained in connection with the Council’s statutory duties. We will retain your information for the period necessary to fulfil the relevant purpose for which it is held and we will also retain any external verification so long as it remains accurate based on the information you provide to use. This will allow us to reuse that information when you register for additional services.

## Further information

For more information about how we use your personal data and your individual privacy rights, you can view the [Council’s Data Primary Privacy Notice](/Council/DataProtection-FOI-Stats/Privacy-notices/Data-Primary-Privacy-Notice.aspx "Data Primary Privacy Notice").

## Independent advice

If you have any questions about the use of your personal information or wish to raise a concern, you will need to firstly contact the [Council’s Data Protection Officer](mailto:dataprotectionofficer@wigan.gov.uk). The Information Commissioner is the independent regulator for both Data Protection and Freedom of Information.

* See further details on the [Information Commissioner’s Office website (external link)](https://ico.org.uk/).

# School term dates

**Local Authorities set the school working pattern for community and voluntary controlled schools.**

We set standard school term dates according to the principles below which we ask Academy, Foundation and Voluntary Aided Wigan schools to follow but they are not obliged to do so. Please contact the school directly or access their website for details of term dates.

* [Standard school term dates for 2023\-24](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Education/Schools/School-working-pattern-2023-24.pdf "School working pattern 2023-24")
* [Standard school term dates for 2024\-25](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Education/Schools/School-Working-Pattern-2024-25.pdf "School Working Pattern 2024-25")
* [Standard school term dates for 2025\-26](/Docs/PDF/Resident/Education/Schools/2025-26-School-Working-Pattern.pdf "2025-26 School Working Pattern").

## School working pattern principles

A school working pattern of 193 days will be set to include:

* 190 pupil days
* Two fixed inset days (start of autumn and spring terms)
* One inset day to be determined by schools in their consortia to take place within the summer term
* The remaining 2 inset day equivalent will be arranged individually by schools
* The academic year will begin in September
* Autumn half term will be the last full week in October
* There will be a minimum two week Christmas break wherever possible
* Spring half term will be the third full week in February
* The Easter break will be set as near to the first two weeks of April as possible but will always include the bank holiday weekend
* The Whitsun, summer half term break, will be the last week in May following the bank holiday
* There will be a 6 week summer break wherever possible
* Part weeks will be kept to a minimum but where necessary will be no fewer than 3 pupil days

\#cludo\-search\-results .search\-results .search\-results\-item:hover .path {
 color: \#005A73
}

 position: relative;

 padding\-left: 24px;
 color: \#333
}

 display: inline\-block;

 left: 0;

 height: 20px;
 content: '';

}

}

}

}

}

 Anyone can rent a garage, and you don't have to be a Wigan Council tenant.

 Help to get online through our TechMates service, guidance on helping others, library support and more.

 Giving notice of marriage if you are having a ceremony in another country.

 How to identify Giant hogweed and what you can do about it.

 Gifts for your wedding and ceremonies available to purchase through us.

 To register a marriage at Wigan Life Centre or Leigh Town Hall, you must make an appointment to give notice.

## [Go Green Week](/Council/The-Deal/Deal-Communities/Go-Green/Index.aspx "Go Green Week")

 A week dedicated to raising awareness of climate change and the things we can do to Go Green

 Golf for all the family including regular golf, adventure golf, crazy golf and FootGolf

 Find a reputable trader in Wigan Borough.

 We're committed to the highest standards of corporate governance and we demonstrate this through our Local Code of Corporate Governance.

## [Greater Manchester Clean Air Plan](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Smoke/GM-Clean-Air-Plan.aspx "Greater Manchester Clean Air Plan")

 Greater Manchester local authorities are working together to produce a Clean Air Plan to tackle harmful air pollution.

## [Greenheart](/Resident/Leisure/Greenheart/Greenheart.aspx "Greenheart")

 Greenheart stretches from Leigh all the way up to Haigh Hall and includes plenty of beautiful parks, woodlands, wetlands, canals and green spaces for you to visit.

 From sports ground maintenance, landscaping, and planting to tree felling and environmental cleansing.

 Groundwork hosts the Prince's Trust Programme in Wigan, a 12 week personal development opportunity for 16\-25 year olds.

# Housing Benefits

* [What is Housing Benefit?Who can claim, how we work it out and more](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Housing-Benefits/Claiming-housing-benefits.aspx)
* [Apply for itMake a new claim for Housing Benefit and/or Council Tax reduction](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/apply-for-benefit.aspx)
* [View your Housing Benefit accountLogin to MyAccount to view your Housing Benefit account details](https://forms.wigan.gov.uk/)
* [Report a changeYou must tell us about a change in your circumstances as soon as possible](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Report-a-change.aspx)
* [Housing Benefit CalculatorFind out how much Housing Benefit you might get](https://www.quickcalc.co.uk/wigan/)
* [Discretionary Housing PaymentsPayments to help tenants to pay their rent where there is a shortfall in housing benefit](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Housing-Benefits/Discretionary-housing-payments.aspx)
* [Local Housing Allowance rateHousing Benefit is worked out based on rent levels and the number of people living in a property](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Housing-Benefits/Local-Housing-Allowance.aspx)
* [AppealsYou must contact us within one calendar month if you do not agree with a decision we have made](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Appeals.aspx)
* [OverpaymentsYou can request an invoice to repay us or employers can complete a Direct Earnings Attachment](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Housing-Benefits/Overpayments/index.aspx)

# Disclaimer

All the information contained on the Wigan Council website has been produced based on available information and has been compiled in good faith for the sole purpose of providing information about Wigan Council.

Some of the information on the Wigan Council website, and the sites we link to, has been provided by an external source and inclusion of this information is outside the control of Wigan Council and does not imply endorsement.

Wigan Council has taken reasonable care to ensure this information is accurate and up to date.

However, Wigan Council cannot accept liability for any claims, actions and demands arising from or relating to losses due to the accuracy of the information given on the Wigan Council website and linked sites.

## [Parking and permits](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Parking/Parking-and-Permits.aspx "Parking and permits")

 Apply for a permit, find a council car park, problem parking, pay or appeal a parking fine, apply for a Blue Badge and more.

## [Parks](/Resident/Leisure/Parks/Index.aspx "Parks")

 Find out about our parks, gardens, nature reserves, woodlands, play areas, football pitches, bowling greens and more.

## [Parks and open spaces](/BeWell/Parks-golf/Index.aspx "Parks and open spaces")

 Enjoy the great outdoors by visiting our country parks, gardens and outdoor spaces for family fun, golf, play activities, walking and more.

## [Past Mayors](/Council/Mayoralty/Past-Mayors.aspx "Past Mayors")

 Find out who has been a Mayor of Wigan since 1974\.

## [Pavement cafe and trade display licence](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Business-and-Trading/Pavement-Cafe-and-Trade-Display-licence/Index.aspx "Pavement cafe and trade display licence")

 You need a license to sell food and drink, display goods or have temporary furniture outside a restaurant or cafe.

## [Pay a council bill/fine](/Pay-for-it/PayCouncilBill.aspx "Pay a council bill/fine")

 How to pay a council bill such as Council Tax, housing rent, business rates, parking fines and more.

## [Pay your Council Tax](/Resident/Council-Tax/Pay-your-Council-Tax/Pay-your-Council-Tax.aspx "Pay your Council Tax")

 Different ways you can pay your Council Tax.

## [Paying for childcare](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Childcare/Paying-for-childcare.aspx "Paying for childcare")

 The government has developed a number of new ways to help parents with their childcare costs.

## [Paying for residential and nursing care](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/will-i-have-to-pay/paying-for-residential-and-nursing-care.aspx "Paying for residential and nursing care")

 Find out how much you will need to pay if you need to go into a care home.

## [Performance and spending](/Council/Performance-and-Spending/index.aspx "Performance and spending")

 How we monitor our performance and where the budget is spent.

## [Personal budgets and direct payments](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/will-i-have-to-pay/personal-budget.aspx "Personal budgets and direct payments")

 How much money is allocated for your care services.

## [Personal Independence Payments (PIP)](/Resident/Benefit-Grants/Welfare-Reform/Personal-Independence-Payments.aspx "Personal Independence Payments (PIP)")

 This replaces Disability Living Allowance for people aged 16 to 64\.

## [Personal training](/BeWell/Membership/Personal-training.aspx "Personal training")

 Benefits of personal training, how to book a PT session and the cost.

## [Personal treatments](/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Business-and-Trading/Personal-treatment-registrations.aspx "Personal treatments")

 Businesses carrying out treatments such as piercing, tattooing, semi permanent skin colouring (including microblading), electrolysis and acupuncture need to be registered.

## [Pests](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Pests.aspx "Pests")

 What to do when faced with pest issues and the costs for treatment of pests.

 Find out about the councils petitions scheme and e\-petitions.

 This Pharmaceutical Needs Assessment (PNA) is a statement of the pharmaceutical needs of Wigan Borough.

## [Planning](/Resident/Planning-and-Building-Control/Planning/Index.aspx "Planning")

 Apply for planning permission, search planning applications and more.

 Planning guidance to help you meet the requirements of planning policies and / or legislation, and to help developers once works begin

## [Playing fields and pitches](/Resident/Leisure/Parks/Playing-fields/Playing-fields.aspx "Playing fields and pitches")

 Got a team and need somewhere to play? Hire one of our pitches.

## [Power cuts](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Power-cuts.aspx "Power cuts")

 Power cuts can occur for any number of reasons. Whatever the reason for a power cut, you can make sure you're prepared for sudden power cuts by following our advice.

## [Preparing for Adulthood](/Resident/Education/Special-Educational-Needs-and-Disability/Local-Offer/Preparing-for-Adulthood-Week/Index.aspx "Preparing for Adulthood")

 A series of events for parent / carers and young adults covering further education, independence, belonging in your community, health and wellbeing, and guidance

## [Preparing for Brexit](/Resident/Crime-Emergencies/Preparing-for-Brexit.aspx "Preparing for Brexit")

 What you need to know to prepare for Brexit.

## [Preventing Falls](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Preventing-Falls.aspx "Preventing Falls")

 As we age, we're more likely to experience falling. Having a fall can result in serious injury and is a common cause of hospital admissions. A fall can also lower your confidence and make you worry about falling again.

## [Prices](/BeWell/Membership/Prices.aspx "Prices")

 Prices for all activities, classes, gym and more.

 Applying for a reception class place for September 2020\.

 Advice for private tenants and useful services to manage and maintain your home.

 How to sell to us, including business tendering opportunities and terms and conditions.

 The Progress with Unity plan is a new movement for change for the next decade.

## [Properties available to buy](/Resident/Housing/Buying/Properties-available-to-buy.aspx "Properties available to buy")

 List of developments with properties available to buy.

## [Property and land](/Business/Property-and-Land/index.aspx "Property and land")

 Information relating to commercial land ownership, property and estate management.

## [Proposed Buildout Removal on Elm Street](/Council/Consultations/Current/Proposed-Buildout-Removal-on-Elm-Street.aspx "Proposed Buildout Removal on Elm Street")

 The Council has been asked to remove the planter buildouts on Elm Street to create more parking for residents. We are aware that residents desire more parking in the street and this could be achieved by removing the two buildouts.

## [Protect your child against the flu](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Children-and-young-people/Health-and-wellbeing/Protect-your-child-against-the-flu.aspx "Protect your child against the flu")

 Remember to book your free flu vaccine for your child to protect them against the flu this season.

## [Public Registers](http://www.wigan.gov.uk/Business/Licensing-Permits-Registrations/Business-and-Trading/Public-Register.aspx "Public Registers")

 Public Registers licensing system

## [Public rights of way](/Resident/Parking-Roads-Travel/Public-rights-of-way/Public-rights-of-way.aspx "Public rights of way")

 What they are, maps, guidance for landowners and reporting a problem.

## [Public Space Protection Orders, Town Centre Consultation](/Council/Consultations/Current/Public-Space-Protection-Orders-Town-Centre-Consultation.aspx "Public Space Protection Orders, Town Centre Consultation")

 When there are problems or nuisance in an area affecting the local community's quality of life, we may put rules in place to deal with it. These rules or 'orders' are designed to make sure we can all use and enjoy public spaces, safe from antisocial behaviour.

## [Putting your bin out for collection](/Resident/Bins-Recycling/Putting-your-bin-out-for-collection.aspx "Putting your bin out for collection")

 What you need to do to ensure your bin is emptied on collection day.

 Our aim is to empower communities to use knowledge and information about their local area. The information will range from health, employment, care, cycle paths and we continue to work with the public to deliver much more.

## [Step Into Care Over 19](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Adults/Step-Into-Care-19.aspx "Step Into Care Over 19")

 Wigan Council have teamed with Wigan \& Leigh College and our Care Providers to create Step Into Care. It's a short training programme for residents aged 19\+ to get a taste of a career in adult social care. Basic First Aid, awareness of Health and Safety, an introduction to palliative care and an awareness of food hygiene are just some of the areas you'll cover. Gaining, transferable skills and enjoying valuable, hands\-on experience in a variety of care settings, this is your start to building a successful career in a growing care sector.

## [Stop smoking](/Resident/Health-Social-Care/Healthy-Routes/Stop-smoking.aspx "Stop smoking")

 HealthyRoutes can give you free 1\-2\-1 support to help you quit smoking.

## [Stopping smoking](/BeWell/Health-Services/Health-Advice/Stopping-smoking.aspx "Stopping smoking")

 Stopping smoking is one of the best things you can do for your health, reducing your risk of heart attacks, cancer and other serious long\-term conditions.

## [Street cleaning](/Resident/Environmental-Problems/Rubbish-and-Litter/Street-cleaning.aspx "Street cleaning")

 Community services, dementia, support for carers and help for those with sight or hearing loss.

[Home](/index.aspx "Go to Home from here")/Cookies

# Cookies

Browser does not support script.

Browser does not support script.

Cookies are used in our web applications to keep track of your preferences, your logins, enabling the web site to run efficiently and collecting data on how people use our web site.

When we provide services, we want to make them easy, useful and reliable. Where services are delivered on the internet, this sometimes involves placing small amounts of information on your device as well as analysing your journey through the site, to help us improve your experience as a user.

These pieces of information are used to improve services for you through, for example:

* enabling a service to recognise your device so you don't have to give the same information several times during one task
* recognising that you may already have given a username and password so you don't need to do it for every web page requested
* measuring how many people are using online services, to help us improve the website

This is done through small files known as cookies. They cannot be used to identify you personally.

A cookie is a small text file usually containing a random and unique identifier that is sent to your browser from a web server and then stored onto your computer's hard drive. They are used to store information about you on your computer.

## Cookies we use

We use Google Analytics and Site Analyze to collect information about how people use this site. We do this to make sure the site is meeting our users' needs and to understand how we could make improvements to the sites user experience.  

Google Analytics and Site Analyze store information about what pages you visit, how long you are on the site, how you got here and what you click on. We do not collect or store your personal information (eg your name, address or IP address) so this information can't be used to identify who you are. We do not allow Google to use or share our Analytics data.

### Google Analytics

The following cookies are set by Google Analytics:

Google Analytics Cookies (.wigan.gov.uk)
| Cookie Name | Expires | Secure |
| --- | --- | --- |
| \_\_utma | 2 years | No |
| \_\_utmc | End of session | No |
| \_\_utmz | 6 months | No |
| \_ga | 2 years | No |

### SiteAnalyze Analytics

The following cookies are set by SiteAnalyze

Site Analyze Website Cookies (.siteimprove.com)
| Cookie Name | Expires | Secure |
| --- | --- | --- |
| nmstat | 1000 days | No |
| --- | --- | --- |

### Hotjar cookies

We use hotjar to monitor analytics and user journeys to help us improve the customer experience on the website. All cookies will last for 365 days.

* **\_hjClosedSurveyInvites** \- This cookie is set once a visitor interacts with a Survey invitation modal popup. It is used to ensure that the same invite does not re\-appear if it has already been shown.
* **\_hjDonePolls** \- This cookie is set once a visitor completes a poll using the Feedback Poll widget. It is used to ensure that the same poll does not re\-appear if it has already been filled in.
* **\_hjMinimizedPolls** \- This cookie is set once a visitor minimizes a Feedback Poll widget. It is used to ensure that the widget stays minimizes when the visitor navigates through your site.
* **\_hjDoneTestersWidgets** \- This cookie is set once a visitor submits their information in the Recruit User Testers widget. It is used to ensure that the same form does not re\-appear if it has already been filled in.
* **\_hjIncludedInSample** \- This session cookie is set to let Hotjar know whether that visitor is included in the sample which is used to generate funnels.
* **\_hjShownFeedbackMessage** \- This cookie is set when a visitor minimizes or completes Incoming Feedback. This is done so that the Incoming Feedback will load as minimized immediately if they navigate to another page where it is set to show.
* **\_hjid** \- This cookie is set when the customer first lands on a page with the Hotjar script. It is used to persist the [Hotjar User ID](https://help.hotjar.com/hc/en-us/articles/115011669147), unique to that site on the browser. This ensures that behaviour in subsequent visits to the same site will be attributed to the same user ID.

### Wigan MBC Cookies

We use these cookies to keep track of user preferences and enable the web site to work efficiently.

Wigan Website Cookies (.wigan.gov.uk)
| Cookie Name | ASP.NET\_SessionId |
| --- | --- |
| Expires | At end of session |
| Secure | No |

The Website is written in a web framework called ASP.NET. The **ASPNET SessionID** cookie is used to keep track of the session while you browse the web site. It can't be used to identify you.

**UserPreferences** keeps track of how you view the site. I keeps a track of whether you view the site in High Contrast or in Large Extra Large or Normal text size.

### YouTube cookies

YouTube Cookies (.youtube.com)
| Cookie Name | Expires | Secure |
| --- | --- | --- |
| HSID | 20 Years | No |
| --- | --- | --- |
| LOGIN \_ INFO | 20 Years | No |
| PREF | 20 Years | No |
| SID | 20 Years | No |
| SSID | 20 Years | No |
| VISITOR\_ INFO1 \_ LIVE | 6 months | No |
| use\_hitbox | End of session | No |

We use YouTube cookies to embed streaming video on our web site. YouTube inserts these cookies for keeping tracking of visitors, user preferences and collecting statistics about views. They can't be used to identify you. See [Google privacy policy (external link)](http://www.google.com/policies/privacy/) for information.

### Blocking cookies

If you don't want to receive cookies, you can change the settings in your browser so it notifies you when cookies are sent to it and can refuse them. You can also delete cookies that have already been set \- the Help function in your browser should tell you how.

Further information on controlling cookies is available at  [AboutCookies.org.uk (external link)](https://www.aboutcookies.org.uk/ "External link to the AboutCookies.org website. ").

### Blocking Google Analytics

Some modern browsers make it possible to block the Google Analytics cookie from collecting data. This is done by installing an add\-on to your browser. Browsers that offer this are Internet Explorer v8 to v11, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari and Opera. 

* [Google Analytics Opt\-out Browser Add\-on (external link)](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout "External link to Google Opt-out Browser Add-on")

Please note: If you choose to disable cookies you will lose some features and functionality on the council's website.​​

## Further Information

For further information on how cookies work and how to block them visit [Wikipedia cookies (external link)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_cookie)

To see how to control cookies in your browser visit the following website: [All about cookies (external link)](https://www.aboutcookies.org.uk/).

# Museum of Wigan Life

* [Visiting usAbout us, where we are, opening times and more](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/visiting-the-museum.aspx)
* [CollectionsOur collections include 30,000 objects relating to life in Wigan Borough](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/Collections.aspx)
* [What's onCalendar of events, exhibitions and activities at the museum](/Resident/Museums-archives/whats-on.aspx)
* [Adult learningWorkshops and tours for adults and community groups](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/adult-learning.aspx)
* [SchoolsClass visits and workshops for pupils](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/Schools.aspx)
* [Museum shopA range of gifts and memorabilia past and present](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/Museum-shop.aspx)
* [Venue hireHire out our galleries or discovery room for meetings, training or special events](/Resident/Museums-archives/Museum-of-Wigan-Life/Venue-hire.aspx)
* [Past ForwardThe people's history magazine for Wigan and Leigh](/Resident/Museums-archives/Past-Forward.aspx)
* [VolunteerGet involved and pass on your expertise and passion for local history](/Council/The-Deal/Volunteering/Culture-and-Leisure/Museums.aspx)
